dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 被遗弃的土地/未占用的土地
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: "Abandoned land" means unused land, which was used in the past for the cultivation of food and feed crops but where the cultivation of food and feed crops was stopped due to biophysical or socioeconomic constraints; "Unoccupied land" is land that is not occupied by any person, is in a state of disuse, or for which it has not been possible to find any person, who by reason of an estate or vested interest, has a right to occupy the land.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: acceso y participación en los beneficios
dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: доступ к биологическим ресурсам и участие в доходах
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The way in which genetic resources may be accessed, and how the benefits that result from their use are shared between the people or countries using the resources (users) and the people or countries that provide them (providers).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: FI; FO; LA; MR; SE; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An authorization (access right), given to a user by a competent authority or by legislation, to exploit a resource or a share of a total allowable catch.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Autorisation (droit d'accès) accordée à un usager par l'autorité compétente ou par la loi, permettant l'exploitation d'une ressource ou d'un quota de la prise maximale autorisée.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Autorización (derecho de acceso) otorgada a un usuario mediante una norma o por una instancia administrativa, para el aprovechamiento de un recurso o para compartir el volumen admisible de captura.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Right of public access to any information held by the state; and any information that is held by another person and that is required for the exercise or protection of any rights.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Droit à l'accès public à toute information gardée par l'Etat, ou à toute information gardée par une autre personne et qui est nécessaire pour pouvoir exercer ou défendre un droit.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Derecho de acceso a información pública controlada por el Estado, o a información controlada por otras personas, necesaria para el ejercicio o protección de cualquier derecho.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Access to justice is defined as the ability of people to seek and obtain a remedy through formal or informal institutions of justice for grievances in compliance with human rights standards. Access to justice involves normative legal protection, legal awareness, legal aid and counsel, adjudication, enforcement, and civil society oversight.

Afforestation is the establishment of forest through planting and/or deliberate seeding on land that, until then, was under a different land use, implies a transformation of land use from non-forest to forest. Reforestation is the re-establishment of forest through planting and/or deliberate seeding on land classified as forest.;
Raw or partly refined agricultural goods whose value mainly reflects the costs of gathering or harvesting them; they are traded for processing or incorporation into final goods.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Inclut: les denrées alimentaires et les produits végétaux, caoutchouc, tabac, café, thé, cacao, soja, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye plantas y productos alimenticios, tabaco, caucho, café, té, cacao, soja, etc.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; LA; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Development of crops, livestock farming, soil fertility, etc. creating the conditions for the fulfillment of agricultural potential, by allocation of inputs, availability of technology, accumulation of knowledge.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Développement des cultures, de l'élevage, de la fertilité du sol, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Desarrollo de cultivos, cría de ganado, fertilidad del suelo, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Agricultural land is typically land devoted to agriculture, the systematic and controlled use of other forms of life—particularly the rearing of livestock and production of crops—to produce food for humans. It is generally synonymous with both farmland or cropland, as well as pasture or rangeland.

Agroforestry is a land use management system in which trees or shrubs are grown around or among crops or pastureland. This intentional combination of agriculture and forestry has varied benefits, including increased biodiversity and reduced erosion.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; LA; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Agroecology is a scientific discipline, a set of practices and a social movement. As a science, it studies how different components of the agroecosystem interact. As a set of practices, it seeks sustainable farming systems that optimize and stabilize yields. As a social movement, it pursues multifunctional roles for agriculture, promotes social justice, nurtures identity and culture, and strengthens the economic viability of rural areas.

Air quality - The degree to which air is polluted; the type and maximum concentration of man-produced pollutants that should be permitted in the atmosphere. Air pollution -The general term alluding to the undesirable addition of substances (gases, liquids, or solid particles) to the atmosphere that are foreign to the natural atmosphere or are present in quantities exceeding natural concentrations.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EN; FI; FD; FO; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Allocation of resources refers to the apportionment of productive assets among different uses. Quotas refer to a limited quantity of a particular product which under official controls can be harvested, produced, exported, or imported.
Class of vertebrates including the (tail-less) frogs and toads (anurans), newts and salamanders, and worm-like (leg-less) Apoda. Animals having a vertebral column or backbone.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Classe de vertébrés comprenant les grenouilles (sans queue) et les crapauds, tritons et salamandres, et les apodes. vermiformes (sans pattes). Animaux ayant une colonne vertébrale ou une épine dorsale.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Clase de los vertebrados que incluye tres grupos: ranas y sapos (anuros), salamandas y tritones, y las vermiformes cecilias sin patas.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any single or multiple materials, whether processed, semi-processed or raw, which is intended to be fed directly to food producing animals.
The physical health of animals for food production, including the presence, risk and control of diseases.
Raising of domesticated animals in an agricultural setting to produce commodities such as food and fiber.
Includes: artificial insemination, semen, semen production/collection centres, deep-frozen bovine semen, embryo transfers, in vitro fertilization, etc. See also "biotechnology".
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Inclut: l'insémination artificielle, la semence, les centres de production et récolte de semence, la semence bovine congelée, le transfert d'embryon, la fertilisation in vitro, etc. Voir aussi "biotechnologie" .
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye inseminación artificial, semen, centros para la producción y recolección de semen, semen bovino ultracongelado, transferencia de embriones, fecundación in vitro, etc. Véase también "biotecnología".

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: How an animal is coping with the conditions in which it lives. An animal is in a good state of welfare if (as indicated by scientific evidence) it is healthy, comfortable, well nourished, safe, able to express innate behaviour and if it is not suffering from unpleasant states such as pain, fear and distress.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: AMR refers to when micro-organisms – bacteria, fungi, viruses, and parasites – evolve resistance to antimicrobial substances, like antibiotics. This can occur naturally through adaption to the environment, the pace of AMR's spread is now on the uptick due to inappropriate and excessive use of antimicrobials.

Beekeeping (or apiculture) is the maintenance of bee colonies by humans in order to collect their honey and other products that the hive produce (including beeswax, propolis, flower pollen, bee pollen, and royal jelly), to pollinate crops, or to produce bees for sale to other beekeepers. Sericulture, or silk farming, is the cultivation of silkworms to produce silk.

Cultivation of plants or breeding of animals in water (embracing freshwater and brackish culture, fish farming). The farming of aquatic organisms including fish, molluscs, crustaceans and aquatic plants with some sort of intervention in the rearing process to enhance production, such as regular stocking, feeding, protection from predators, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Culture de plantes ou élevage d'animaux dans l'eau, (ce qui comprend la culture en eaux douces et saumâtres, et l'exploitation piscicole). ;L'élevage d'organismes aquatiques comprenant les poissons, les mollusques, les crustacés et les plantes aquatiques, accompagné d une intervention technique visant à augmenter la production telle que le repeuplement, la nourriture, la protection contre les prédateurs, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cultivo de plantas o cría de alevines de animales en agua (abarca la que se realiza en agua dulce y en agua salobre, explotación piscícola). El cultivo de animales acuáticos incluye peces, moluscos, crustáceos y plantas acuáticas mediante diversos tipos de intervención durante el proceso de cría destinados al aumento de la producción, como repoblación periódica, alimentación, protección de predadores, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An aquatic animal is an animal, either vertebrate or invertebrate, that lives in the water for most or all of its lifetime.

Plants that have adapted to living in aquatic environments (saltwater or freshwater). Aquatic plants can only grow in water or in soil that is permanently saturated with water. They are therefore a common component of wetlands.

There is no universal definition for what type of fisheries or aquaculture count as ‘artisanal’ or ‘small-scale’. Commonly, these terms are used for describing fisheries and aquaculture that use relatively small production units with low input and output, and low levels of technology or capital investment. Fishing for sport or recreation are excluded.;

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Authorization is the process of endowing or conferring a person with legal power or sanction to do something specific.
Bank is the land alongside a body of water.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The prinicipal law within a particular sector or technical area.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The area that is defined by its natural, hydrological boundaries.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La superficie qui résulte définie par ses propres limites naturelles, hydrologiques.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Area delimitada mediante sus confines hidrológicos naturales.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The path where a river runs, or where a river once ran; the bottom earthen part of a river or lake, not including the riverbanks.

A drinkable liquid. Includes: beer, non-alcoholic beverages (fruit juices, concentrates, nectars, etc.).;Note: The following beverages have specific key words: "potable water"; "mineral water", "viticulture/oenological practices", "coffee/cocoa/tea"; and "milk/dairy products".
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Inclut: bière, boissons non-alcoholiques (jus de fruits, concentrés, nectars, etc.).;Note: Les boissons suivantes ont un mot-clé spécifique: "eau potable","eau minérale", "viticulture/pratiques vinicoles", "café/cacao/thé", and "lait/produits laitiers".
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye la cerveza, las bebidas no alcohólicas (jugos de frutas, extractos, néctares, etc.).;Nota: A las siguientes bebidas corresponde una palabra clave especifica: "agua potable", "agua mineral", "viticultura/prácticas enológicas", "café/cacao/té", y "leche/productos lácteos".

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FO; PL; SE; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Variety among living organisms from all sources including, inter alia, terrestrial, marine and other aquatic ecosystems and the ecological complexes of which they are part; this includes diversity within species, between species and of ecosystems (Article 2 of the Convention on Biodiversity).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Variété des organismes vivants de toute origine y compris, entre autres, les écosystèmes terrestres, marins et autres écosystèmes aquatiques et les complexes écologiques dont ils font partie; cela comprend la diversité au sein des espèces et entre espèces ainsi que celle des écosystèmes (article 2 de la Convention sur la diversité biologique).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Variaciones entre los organismos vivientes de todo tipo que incluye, entre otros, ecosistemas terrestres, marinos y otros ecosistemas acuáticos, así como también ecosistemas complejos de los cuales los anteriores hacen parte; incluye la diversidad al interior de las especies, entre las especies y de los ecosistemas (Artículo 2º de la Convención sobre Biodiversidad).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FD; LA; PL; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Covers all energy forms derived from organic fuels (biofuels) of biological origin used for energy production. It comprises both purpose-grown energy crops, as well as multipurpose plantations and by-products (residues and wastes). The term by-products includes solid, liquid and gaseous by-products derived from human activities. Biomass may be considered as one form of transformed solar energy.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Recouvre l'ensemble des formes d'énergie dérivée des combustibles organiques (biocarburants) d'origine biologique utilisés pour la production d'énergie. Elle comprend aussi bien les cultures faites à cette fin que les cultures d'ordres divers et les sous-produits agricoles (résidus et déchets). Le mot "sous-produit" comprend les dérivés solides, liquides et gazeux provenant des activités humaines. La biomasse peut être considérée comme un type d'énergie solaire transformée.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Comprende todas las formas de energía derivada de combustibles orgánicos (biocombustibles) de origen biológico utilizados para producir energía. Comprende tanto los cultivos destinados a producir energía que se cultivan específicamente, como las plantaciones polivalentes y los subproductos (residuos y desechos). El término subproductos incluye los subproductos sólidos, líquidos y gaseosos derivados de las actividades humanas. Se puede considerar a la biomasa como una forma de energía solar transformada.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; LA; PL; SE; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Biofuel is fuel produced directly or indirectly from biomass.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FI; FO; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Biological control or biocontrol is a method of controlling pests such as insects, mites, weeds and plant diseases using other organisms. This keyword refers to the licensing, use, storage, labelling, certification, safety, biological pest control agents, organisms and micro-organisms, pathogens.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce terme se réfère à la licence, l'utilisation, l'entreposage, l'étiquetage, la certification, l'homologation des agents biologiques utilisés pour la lutte contre les parasites, aux mesures de sûreté, aux organismes et aux micro-organismes, aux pathogènes.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a la licencia, uso, almacenamiento, etiquetado, certificación, manejo seguro de organismos y microorganismos para el control biológico de plagas y agentes patógenos.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Biosafety is a term used to describe efforts to reduce and eliminate the potential risks resulting from biotechnology and its products. For the purposes of the Biosafety Protocol, this is based on the precautionary approach, whereby the lack of full scientific certainty should not be used as an excuse to postpone action when there is a threat of serious or irreversible damage.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Terme utilisé pour décrire l'effort tendant à réduire ou à éliminer les dangers résultants de la biotechnologie et de ses produits. Vu les objectifs du Protocole sur la prévention des risques biotechnologiques, cette prévention se base sur l'approche de précaution, qui part du principe que l'absence de certitude scientifique absolue ne doit pas servir de prétexte pour différer les décisions, s'il y a danger de préjudice grave ou irréversible.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Seguridad de la biotecnología es un término utilizado para describir los esfuerzos para reducir y eliminar los riesgos potenciales resultantes de la biotecnología y sus productos. A los efectos del Protocolo sobre Seguridad de la Biotecnología, esta se basa en el criterio de precaución, según el cual la falta de certeza científica absoluta no debe utilizarse como excusa para aplazar la adopción de medidas cuando exista una amenaza de daño grave o irreversible.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Management of all biological and environmental risks associated with the environment, including food and agriculture, including forestry and fisheries.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Gestion de tous les risques de type biologique et environnemental associés à l'environnement, y compris alimentation et à l'agriculture.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La gestión de todos los riesgos biológicos y ambientales asociados al ambiente, comprendidos los alimentos y la agricultura.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; LA; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Biosphere reserves are areas of terrestrial and coastal ecosystems promoting solutions to reconcile the conservation of biodiversity with its sustainable use. They are internationally recognized, nominated by national governments and remain under sovereign jurisdiction of the states where they are located. UNESCO provides the secretariat of the World Network of Biosphere Reserves in accordance with the provisions of the Statutory Framework.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Les réserves de la biosphère sont des aires où se trouvent des écosystèmes terrestres ou côtiers/marins ou une combinaison des deux, établies pour promouvoir et démontrer le rapport entre les être humains et la biosphère (UNESCO).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Las reservas de biosfera son áreas de ecosistemas terrestres y marino/costeros, o una combinación de ellos, que se crean con la finalidad de promover y demostrar una interacción equilibrada entre la actividad humana y la biosfera.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: "Any technological application that uses biological systems, living organisms, or derivates thereof, to make or modify products or processes for specific use"(Convention on Biological Diversity).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toute application technologique qui utilise des systèmes biologiques, des organismes vivants, ou des dérivés de ceux-ci, pour réaliser ou modifier des produits ou des procédés à usage spécifique.(Convention sur le diversité biologique)
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Toda aplicación tecnológica que utilice sistemas biológicos y organismos vivos o sus derivados para la creación o modificación de productos o procesos para usos específicos (Convenio sobre la Diversidad Biológica).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate animals distinguished by the possession of feathers, wings, a beak, and typically by being able to fly.

Infant milk substitutes, feeding bottles, "natural" food, formula, dry milk. Also refers to national public information campaigns to promote breastfeeding, to the International Code on marketing of breast milk substitutes, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Lait substitutif pour nourrissons, biberons, aliments "naturels", formules, lait en poudre. Ce terme se réfère aussi aux campagnes nationales d'information au public pour promouvoir l'allaitement au sein, au Code international sur la commercialisation des substituts du lait maternel, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Substitutos de la leche materna, biberones, alimentos "naturales", combinaciones, leche en polvo. También se refiere a las campañas nacionales que promueven el alactamiento materno, al Código Internacional para la comercialización de substitutos de la leche materna, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Plant breeder's rights are a form of intellectual property (IP). They grant a limited commercial monopoly to breeders of new plant varieties. PBR allows a breeder the right to exclude others from a range of activities including producing and reproducing a protected variety.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Group of productive enterprises or organizations that produce or supply goods, services, or sources of income
The part of catch unintentionally captured during a fishing operation, in addition to target species, and consisting of discards and incidental catches of vulnerable species.

Cadastre is a public record, survey, or map of the value, extent, and ownership of land as a basis of taxation. Land registration is the official recording of legally recognised interests in land and is usually part of a cadastral system. From a legal perspective a distinction can be made between deeds registration, where the documents filed in the registry are the evidence of title, and registration of title, in which the register itself serves as the primary evidence.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Registre officiel, greffiers, aires d'immatriculation, procédures d'immatriculation, instruments d'immatriculation, inventaire et évaluation de la propriété immobilière.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Registro oficial, archivos oficiales, registro civil, áreas de registración, procedimientos de registración, instrumentos de registración, tasas de inventario y evaluación de la propiedad inmobiliaria.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The phylogenetic family which includes camels, llamas, alpacas, guanacos, viunas.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Famille phylogénétique comprenant les chameaux, llamas, alpagas, guanacos et vigognes.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Familia filogenética que incluye camellos alpacas, llamas, huanacos y vicuñas.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The process through which the ability of individuals and organizations to perform functions, solve problems and set and achieve sustainable objectives is developed and maintained over time.
An animal that has a phenotype not significantly affected by human selection, but that is captive or otherwise lives under direct human supervision or control, including zoo animals and pets.

Cartilaginous fishes are jawed vertebrates with paired fins, paired nares, scales, a heart with its chambers in series, and skeletons made of cartilage rather than bone. The class is divided into two subclasses: Elasmobranchii (sharks, rays, skates, and sawfish) and Holocephali (chimaeras, sometimes called ghost sharks, which are sometimes separated into their own class). Also include “Picked dogfish" , “Spurdog”, “Dogfish”, “Porbeagle”, “Catshark”.
Large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, domesticated for meat or milk, or as beasts of burden; cows and oxen.
Any plant of the grass family yielding an edible grain, as wheat, rye, oats, rice, or corn.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Process that guarantees compliance with foreseen standards and requirements. Refers to all procedures prescribed by law for obtaining a certificate.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Processus qui garantit la conformité aux procédures et aux normes de qualité prévues. Ce terme se réfère aux procédures de certification prévues par la loi pour obtenir un certificat.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Procedimiento que garantiza la conformidad con las normas y niveles de calidad previstos. Se refiere a todo procedimiento establecido por ley para la obtención de una certificación

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Work that harms children’s well-being and hinders their education, development and future livelihoods.

Civil and political rights are a class of rights that protect individuals' freedom from infringement by governments, social organizations, and private individuals. They ensure one's entitlement to participate in the civil and political life of society and the state without discrimination or repression.

A Civil Code is a codification of private law relating to persons, family, property, inheritance, obligations and contracts. In some jurisdictions, some core areas of private law (commercial and corporate law) are codified under a separate commercial code.;A Civil Code is a codification of private law relating to persons, family, property, inheritance, obligations and contracts. In some jurisdictions, some core areas of private law (commercial and corporate law) are codified under a separate commercial code.;

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Classification refers to an administrative decision to place something within a legal category subject to specific rules. Declassification refers to an administrative decision that moves something from a legal category subject to specific rules to a category subject to ordinary law.

One of the flexibility mechanisms defined in the Kyoto Protocol (IPCC, 2007) that provides for emissions reduction projects which generate Certified Emission Reduction units which may be traded in emissions trading schemes.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FD; LA; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Chemical and biological agents to remove food residue, dirt, grease or other objectionable matter and/or reduce the number of micro-organisms to a level that does not compromise food safety and public health. Cleaning products may contain toxic chemicals, some of which emit volatile organic compounds causing respiratory, dermatological and environmental harm.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A change in global or regional climate patterns, in particular a change apparent from the mid to late 20th century onwards and attributed largely to the increased levels of atmospheric carbon dioxide produced by the use of fossil fuels.
Coal is a combustible black or brownish-black sedimentary rock, formed as rock strata consisting chiefly of carbonized plant matter, found mainly in underground seams and used as fuel.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FI; LA; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Measures undertaken for the conservation, protection, utilization, and management of coastal areas.

The "Codex Alimentarius" is a collection of international standards for the safety and quality of food as well as codes of good manufacturing practice and other guidelines to protect the health of the consumer and remove unfair practices in international trade.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Le "Codex Alimentarius" est un ensemble de normes internationales pour la sécurité et la qualité de l'alimentation, aussi bien que des codes de bonne pratique de fabrication, et autres directives pour protéger la santé des consommateurs et éliminer les pratiques illégales de commerce international.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: El "Codex Alimentarius" es un conjunto de normas internacionales para garantizar la seguridad y calidad de los alimentos, así como los códigos de conducta para su correcta transformación y otras directivas para la protección de la salud de los consumidores y para eliminar prácticas ilegales de comercio internacional.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Gathering of wild plants and non-timber forest products for human use or consumption.
Property held by two or more persons in common with each other, e.g. joint tenants.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La propriété détenue par deux ou plus personnes en commun l'une avec l'autre, soit la copropriété.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Dos o más personas en régimen de propiedad compartida, por ejemplo, alquiler asociado.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Community management or common-pool resource management is the management of a common resource or issue by a community through the collective action of stakeholders.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Contractual right entitling the beneficiary to exploit a body of water or expanse of land belonging to the State subject to particular terms.

Herbs are the leaves from shrubs, best fresh although dried are common, used to add aroma to a dish. Spices are dried seeds, root, bark or other vegetable matter, used to add flavour and colour to a dish. Condiments are added to a dish to add or complement its flavour. They are often prepared mixes (like mustard or soy sauce), although the broad definition can include spices (e.g. pepper).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An Act of Parliament that amends or repeals the text of the Constitution in whole or in part.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Une loi du Parlement qui modifie ou abroge le texte de la Constitution en tout ou en partie.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Una ley del Parlamento que enmienda o deroga el texto de la Constitución en su totalidad o en parte.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EG; EN; FD; LA; MR; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Consumer protection is the practice of safeguarding buyers of goods and services, and the public, against unfair practices in the marketplace. Consumer protection measures are intended to prevent businesses from engaging in fraud or specified unfair practices in order to gain an advantage over competitors or to mislead consumers.

The continental shelf of a coastal State comprises the seabed and subsoil of the submarine areas that extend beyond its territorial sea throughout the natural prolongation of its land territory to the outer edge of the continental margin, or to a distance of 200 nautical miles from the baselines from which the breadth of the territorial sea is measured where the outer edge of the continental margin does not extend up to that distance (article 76 of the Law of the Sea Convention).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Le plateau continental d'un Etat côtier comprend les fonds marins et leur sous-sol au-delà de sa mer territoriale, sur toute l'étendue du prolongement naturel du territoire terrestre de cet Etat jusqu'au rebord externe de la marge continentale, ou jusqu'à 200 milles marins des lignes de base à partir desquelles est mesurée la largeur de la mer territoriale, lorsque le rebord externe de la marge continentale se trouve à une distance inférieure (article 76 de la Convention sur le droit de la mer).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La plataforma continental de un Estado ribereño comprende el lecho y el subsuelo de las áreas submarinas que se extienden más allá de su mar territorial y a todo lo largo de la prolongación natural de su territorio continental hasta el borde exterior del margen continental, o bien hasta una distancia de doscientas millas marinas contadas desde las líneas de base a partir de las cuales se mide la anchura del mar territorial, en los casos en que el borde exterior del margen continental no llegue a esa distancia (Convención sobre el Derecho del Mar, art. 76).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Contract farming is agricultural production carried out according to an agreement between a buyer and farmers, which establishes conditions for the production and marketing of a farm product or products.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A legal agreement between two parties.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A corporation or association established to give economic services to its members without gain to itself. Includes agricultural cooperatives, cooperative societies, peasant associations, fishermen's cooperatives, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Une entreprise ou association établie pour fournir des services économiques à ses membres sans but lucratif. Sont incluses: les coopératives agricoles, les sociétés coopératives, les association d'agriculteurs, les coopératives de pêcheurs, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Toda empresa o asociación estable que ofrece servicios económicos a sus miembros sin ánimo de lucro. Incluye cooperativas agrícolas, asociaciones cooperativas, cooperativas de campesinos, cooperativas de pescadores, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Corals are marine invertebrates within the class Anthozoa of the phylum Cnidaria. They typically live in compact colonies of many identical individual polyps. Coral species include the important reef builders that inhabit tropical oceans and secrete calcium carbonate to form a hard skeleton.
COVID-19 is the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus SARS-Cov-2, which had not been previously identified in humans.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A body of people presided over by a judge, judges, or magistrate, and acting as a tribunal in civil and criminal cases. A Tribunal is a body established to settle certain types of dispute.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A contractual agreement in which a borrower receives something of value now and agrees to repay the lender at some date in the future, generally with interest. The term also refers to the borrowing capacity of an individual or company.
A crop is any cultivated plant, fungus, or alga that is harvested for food, clothing, livestock, fodder, biofuel, medicine, or other uses.

A large group of mainly aquatic arthropods which include crabs, lobsters, shrimps, woodlice, barnacles, and many minute forms. They are very diverse, but most have four or more pairs of limbs and several other appendages.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FD; FO; LA; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Cultural Heritage is an expression of the ways of living developed by a community and passed on from generation to generation, including customs, practices, places, objects, artistic expressions, values and food.
Any wild, exotic, or venomous animal or other animal which, because of its size, disposition, or other characteristic, would constitute a danger to persons or property.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Data collection is the process of gathering and measuring information on targeted variables in an established system, which then enables one to answer relevant questions and evaluate outcomes. Reporting - the act of giving an official notification, for example about its accounts or activities.

Decentralization refers to the transfer of authority from a central government to a sub-national entity. There are many ways in which a government may devolve power to the sub-national level - decentralization can be political, administrative, fiscal, or economic.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EG; EN; FI; MR; SE; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The sea-bed and ocean floor and subsoil thereof beyond the limits of national jurisdiction. The area underneath the High Seas. (article 1 of the Law of the Sea)
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Les fonds marins et leur sous-sol au-delà des limites de la juridiction nationale. La zone se trouvant sous la haute-mer. (article 1 de la Convention sur le droit de la mer)
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Los fondos marinos y oceánicos y su subsuelo fuera de los límites de la jurisdicción nacional. El área que se encuentra por debajo del alta mar. (artículo 1º de la Convención sobre el Derecho del Mar)

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Land degradation in arid, semi-arid, and dry subhumid areas resulting from various factors, including climatic variations and human activities.

Diadromous is a general category describing fish that spend portions of their life cycles partially in fresh water and partially in salt water. These represent both anadromous and catadromous fish. Anadromous fishes spend most of their adult lives at sea, but return to fresh water to spawn.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Sudden, calamitous event that seriously disrupts the functioning of a community or society and causes human, material, and economic or environmental losses that exceed the community’s or society’s ability to cope using its own resources. Though often caused by nature, disasters can have human origins.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; PL; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Disinfection - the process of cleaning something using chemicals that kill bacteria and other organisms (very small living things) that cause disease. Disinfestation - physical or chemical process to destroy or remove small undesirable animal forms, particularly arthropods or rodents, present upon the person, clothing, or environment of an individual or domestic animals.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Relates to alternate dispute settlement mechanisms such as arbitration, mediation, conciliation, negotiation, enquiry, resort to agencies or arrangements, Alternative Dispute Resolution. It excludes judicial settlement of disputes, which is covered by keyword "special court/tribunal".
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce terme se réfère aux mécanismes de règlement des différends comme l'arbitrage, la médiation, la conciliation, la négociation, les enquêtes, le recours à agences ou à transactions, etc. Ce mot-clé exclut le jugement des différends, qui est compris dans le "cours spéciales/ tribunaux".
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a los mecanismos alternativos para la solución de controversias, tales como arbitraje, mediación, conciliación, negociación, pesquisa, recurrir a agencias o a transacciones, etc. Excluye la sentencia en caso de conflicto, incluida en la palabra clave "tribunal especial/tribunal".

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; LA; SE; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Drainage is the natural or artificial removal of a surface's water and sub-surface water from an area with excess of water. Land reclamation is the process of creating new land from the sea.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: sistema de alerta rápida/sistema de intervención de emergencia
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: نظام الانذار المبكر /نظام التدخل في حالات الطوارئ
dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: системы раннего предупреждения/системы оказания чрезвычайной помощи
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 预警系统/紧急干预系统
dictionary_term.Spanish_Variants: sistema de intervención de emergencia/sistema de alerta rápida
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Early Warning System - Systems which predict or forecast the formation or movement of a potentially disastrous phenomenon which may develop into or cause a disaster, natural or otherwise. Emergency intervention system - a comprehensive management system which integrates the response to emergencies. This system provides the governance structure and the operational facilities to respond to emergencies.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: المنتجات الصديقة للبيئة / عمليات صديقة للبيئة
dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: экологически чистые продукты/ экологически чистые процессы
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 生态友好的产品/生态友好型工艺
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Eco-friendly products or processes do not harm the environment whether in their production, use or disposal. They help preserve the environment by significantly reducing the pollution they could produce.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Relates to the organic form of production, i.e. without the use of chemical products and pesticides, and to biological and organic products.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à la production biologique de produits agricoles, c'est à dire sans l'utilisation de produits chimiques et de pesticides, et aux produits biologiques.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a la producción orgánica que utiliza productos de origen biológico, excluyendo el uso de plaguicidas y productos químicos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Economic, social and cultural rights include the rights to adequate food, to adequate housing, to education, to health, to social security, to take part in cultural life, to water and sanitation, and to work.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FO; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Ecosystem refers to the variety of habitats and communities of different species that interact in a complex web of interdependent relationships. From an ecological standpoint, preservation is defined as maintaining an intact ecosystem so that it functions at the same level as it has historically. Preservation also commonly entails prohibiting any human use that could compromise ecosystem function.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce terme se réfère à la variété d'habitats et aux colonies de différentes espèces qui interagissent à l'intérieur d'un réseau complexe de relations interdépendantes.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Esta palabra clave incluye hábitats y grandes sistemas naturales, tales como praderas, manglares, humedales, bosques tropicales, arrecifes de coral, y su equilibrio ecológico.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The process of facilitating learning, or the acquisition of knowledge, skills, values, beliefs, and habits.

The Law of the Sea Convention establishes a special legal regime of the Exclusive Economic Zone, which is an area beyond and adjacent to the territorial sea and which shall not extend beyond 200 nautical miles from the baselines from which the breadth of the territorial sea is measured. Provisions may concern the right and duties of the coastal state in this zone (exploitation, exploration - for purposes of scientific research for instance - conservation and management of the natural resources/marine environment), the rights and duties of other states in this zone.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La Convention sur le Droit de la Mer établit un régime juridique particulier pour la Zone Economique Exclusive, qui est une étendue au-delà de et adjacente à la mer territoriale et qui ne doit pas s'étendre au-delà de 200 milles nautiques des lignes de base à partir desquelles est mesurée la largeur de la mer territoriale. Les dispositions peuvent concerner les droits et les devoirs de l'Etat côtier sur cette zone (exploitation, exploration - par exemple pour la recherche scientifique - la conservation et la gestion des ressources naturelles et de l'environnement marin), les droits et les devoirs des autres Etats sur cette zone.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La Convención de las Naciones Unidas sobre el Derecho del Mar establece un régimen jurídico especial de Zona Económica Exclusiva, que es un área que se encuentra más allá y adyacente al mar territorial y que no debe extenderse más allá de 200 millas náuticas a partir de las líneas de base desde las cuales se mide el ancho del mar territorial. Las disposiciones pueden interesar el derecho y las obligaciones del estado ribereño en esa zona (explotación, exploración, por ejemplo con fines de investigación científica, de ordenación y conservación de los recursos naturales y del medio ambiente marino), los derechos y obligaciones de otros estados en esta zona.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to liquid waste, including provisions regarding pollutants, effluent, waste water, waste water treatment, quality standards of receiving waters, waste water recycling. Includes sources of pollution not associated with a distinct discharge point, such as rainwater, runoff from agricultural lands, timber operations.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère aux déchets liquides, incluses les dispositions concernant les polluants, les effluents, les eaux usées, le traitement des eaux usées, les normes de qualité des eaux recevantes, le recyclage des eaux usées. Sont aussi comprises les sources de pollution non associées à un point de déversement spécifique, telles que les eaux pluviales, les ruissellements à partir de terres agricoles, les eaux usées provenant de l'industrie du bois.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Alude a la eliminación de residuos líquidos, incluye también disposiciones relativas a contaminantes, efluentes, aguas negras, tratamiento de aguas residuales, normas de calidad de las aguas donde se descarga y reciclado de las aguas residuales. Incluye fuentes de contaminación no asociadas con un punto focal de desagüe, como el agua de lluvia, escorrentía de tierras agrícolas y actividades madereras.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: In the climate change context, emissions refer to the release of greenhouse gases and/or their precursors and aerosols into the atmosphere over a specified area and period of time.
Emissions trading (also known as cap and trade) is a market-based approach to controlling pollution by providing economic incentives for achieving reductions in the emissions of pollutants.
An endangered species is a species of wild animal or plant that is in danger of extinction throughout all or a significant portion of its range.

Energy conservation is the effort made to reduce the consumption of energy by using less of an energy service. This can be achieved either by using energy more efficiently or by reducing the amount of service used. Energy generation is the process of generating electric power from sources of primary energy.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Compliance: the state of conformity with regulatory requirements including, but not limited to, legislative provisions, regulations, rules, standards, and orders. Enforcement: actions taken to induce, encourage, or compel compliance with regulatory requirements.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental Audit is a management tool used to evaluate environmental performance.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental charges are paid for the right to use the environment and the purpose for the implementation thereof is to avoid or decrease possible damages related to the use of natural resources, emission of pollutants into the environment and waste disposal.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental Impact Assessment is a process of evaluating the likely environmental impacts of a proposed project or development, taking into account inter-related socio-economic, cultural and human-health impacts, both beneficial and adverse.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Etude d'Impact sur l'Environnement
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Evaluación del Impacto Ambiental

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: All planning activities with the objective of preserving or enhancing environmental values or resources.

Environmental security can be interpreted broadly to cover any major ecological development that seriously threatens the welfare of human societies, even without increasing the likelihood of war. Such threats are posed by the panoply of environmental problems, which include depletion of the ozone layer, global warming, desertification, deforestation, and the loss of biodiversity, that are collectively referred to under the rubric "global change."

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental standards are standards for materials, products and production processes to ensure that negative impacts on the environment are minimal or kept within certain limits.
Equine animal means any member of the family equidae, including, but not limited to, horses, ponies, mules, asses, and zebras.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; FI; FD; FO; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Tools, equipment and machinery to carry out farm operations efficiently from the viewpoint of financial and capital costs as well as social and environmental costs.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Fairness of rights, distribution, and access. Depending on context, this can refer to resources, services, or power.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The accelerated removal of topsoil from the land surface through water, wind and tillage.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Ex situ conservation is the protection and maintenance of genetic resources outside their original environment.
Exploration is the act of searching an area for the purpose of discovery of resources or information.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Involuntary sale or transfer of land/property to the State or Government. Includes the procedures of expropriation, entitlements and determination of compensation etc.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Technical field support. Extension services are one component of a government's (or agency's) plan to improve agricultural productivity through assistance and supervision.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Assistance technique sur le champ. Les services de vulgarisation agricole font partie du plan du gouvernement (ou d'une agence) pour améliorer, au moyen de l'assistance et de la supervision, la productivité agricole.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Asistencia técnica de campo. Los servicios de extensión constituyen uno de los componentes de los planes del gobierno o de una agencia para mejorar la productividad agrícola a través de la asistencia y supervisión.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Family farming includes all family-based agricultural activities, and it is linked to several areas of rural development. Family farming is a means of organizing agricultural, forestry, fisheries, pastoral and aquaculture production which is managed and operated by a family and predominantly reliant on family labour, including both women’s and men’s.

The protection of farmers’ rights includes the protection of traditional knowledge relevant to plant genetic resources, the right to equitably participate in sharing benefits arising from their utilization, and the right to participate in making decisions, at the national level, on matters related to their conservation and sustainable use (International Treaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture, art. 9).

Techniques and requirements directed to cultivation and farming practices of specific crops. Methods compatible with the requirements of the protection of the environment and maintenance of the countryside.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce mot-clé doit être utilisé strictement en relation aux techniques et aux conditions prévues pour la culture et pour la culture obligatoire de certaines cultures spécifiques prescrites par l'autorité compétente dans le contexte de schémas d'irrigation ou de plans de développement.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Técnicas y requisitos orientados a las prácticas de explotación agrícola de determinados cultivos. Métodos compatibles con los requisitos de protección ambiental y conservación del paisaje.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A political entity characterized by a union of partially self-governing provinces, states, or other regions under a central federal government (federalism).
Any intentionally added ingredient not normally consumed as feed by itself, whether or not it has nutritional value, which affects the characteristics of feed or animal products.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Fertilizer: a substance that is used to provide nutrients to plants, usually via application to the soil, but also to foliage or through water in rice systems, fertigation, hydroponics or aquaculture operations. Nutrients: Elements essential for normal growth and reproduction of plants, generally not including carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen.
Fiber crops are plants that are deliberately grown for the production of fiber for textile (clothes), cordage (e.g., ropes), and filling (e.g., stuffing upholstery and mattresses).
Measures that include the circulation of money, the granting of credit, the making of investments, and the provision of banking facilities in the agricultural sector.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EG; EN; FD; FO; LA; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The act of obtaining or furnishing money or capital for a purchase or enterprise.

Fiscal measures are policy instruments using government revenue collection (mainly taxes) and expenditure (spending) to influence the economy. Market measures are policy instruments that use markets, price, and other economic variables to provide incentives for producers and consumers.

Sign of fish disease include abnormalities and symptoms such as a fish not feeding, ulcers on the body, or cloudy eyes. The most common indicators of disease are fish coming to the surface and gasping for oxygen, or higher than usual levels of sickness or death in an aquaculture system.
Refers to capture fisheries and aquaculture products, whether fresh, frozen, smoked, canned, or fishmeal.

dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: управление рыболовством и сохранение рыбных запасов
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The integrated process of information gathering, analysis, planning, consultation, decision-making, allocation of resources and formulation and implementation, with enforcement as necessary, of regulations or rules which govern fisheries activities in order to ensure the continued productivity and sustainability of the resources and the accomplishment of other fisheries objectives.
An area to which a specific regime for fishing applies. This regime may apply to a specific fisheries and may also generally restrict or prohibit fisheries.
Appropriate licence, authorization or permit granted to engage in fishing or any related fisheries activity.
A charge related to authorizations or services provided by a public authority in relation to fisheries activities.

Any fishing device such as nets, lines, etc. (individual or collective). May also refer to the import, export, sale, possession of such gears. Provisions on fishing methods, such as the use of explosives or electricity, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toute sorte de dispositifs de pêche comme les filets, les lignes, etc. (individuels ou collectifs). Ce terme peut aussi se référer à l'importation/exportation, la vente, la possession de ces engins. Dispositions sur les méthodes de pêche interdites ou permises, comme l'utilisation d'explosifs, d'électricité, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cualquier dispositivo de pesca, como redes, líneas, etc. (individual o colectiva), métodos y artes de pesca. También puede aludir a la importación, exportación, venta o posesión de tales aparejos. Disposiciones sobre métodos de pesca, como el uso de explosivos o electricidad, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any vessel used for fishing (including sport fishing) or for the storage, transhipment, refuelling or supplying of other fishing vessels. It also includes vessels processing fish at sea.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Tout type de bateau utilisé pour la pêche (y compris la pêche sportive) ou pour le dépôt, le transbordement, le ravitaillement d'autres bateaux de pêche. Ce terme se réfère aussi aux bateaux qui effectuent le traitement du poisson directement en mer.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cualquier embarcación utilizada para pescar (incluyendo la pesca deportiva y recreativa) o para el almacenamiento, trasbordo, reabastecimiento o aprovisionamiento de otras embarcaciones de pesca. También incluye los barcos-factorías que procesan pescado en el mar.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The overflowing of the normal confines of a stream or other body of water, or the accumulation of water over areas not normally submerged.
Relates to the cultivation of flowers.

Food additive means any substance not normally consumed as a food by itself and not normally used as a typical ingredient of the food, whether or not it has nutritive value, the intentional addition of which to food for a technological (including organoleptic) purpose in the manufacture, processing, preparation, treatment, packing, packaging, transport or holding of such food results, or may be reasonably expected to result (directly or indirectly), in it or its by-products becoming a component of or otherwise affecting the characteristics of such foods. The term does not include contaminants or substances added to food for maintaining or improving nutritional qualities.

Food assistance refers to the set of interventions designed to provide access to food to vulnerable and food insecure populations. Generally included are instruments like food transfers, vouchers and cash transfers to ensure access to food of a given quantity, quality or value.

Food loss and waste refer to the decrease in mass (quantitative) or nutritional value (qualitative) of food - edible parts - throughout the supply chain that was intended for human consumption. Food Loss refers to food that gets spilled, spoilt or otherwise lost, or incurs reduction of quality and value during its process in the food supply chain before it reaches its final product stage. Food loss typically takes place at production, post-harvest, processing, and distribution stages in the food supply chain. Food waste refers to food that completes the food supply chain up to a final product, of good quality and fit for consumption, but still doesn't get consumed because it is discarded, whether or not after it is left to spoil or expire. Food waste typically (but not exclusively) takes place at retail and consumption stages in the food supply chain.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: contrôle de qualité alimentaire/innocuité des produits alimentaires
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: control de calidad de los alimentos/inocuidad de los alimentos
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Food safety - Protecting the food supply from microbial, chemical (i.e. rancidity, browning) and physical (i.e. drying out, infestation) hazards or contamination that may occur during all stages of food production and handling-growing, harvesting, processing, transporting, preparing, distributing and storing. The goal of food safety monitoring is to keep food wholesome. Food quality is the inspection, analysis, and other relevant actions taken to provide control over what is being done, manufactured, or fabricated, so that a desirable level of quality is achieved and maintained.

A situation that exists when all people, at all times, have physical, social and economic access to sufficient, safe and nutritious food that meets their dietary needs and food preferences for an active and healthy life. Based on the definition, four food security dimensions can be identified: food availability, economic and physical access to food, food utilization and stability over time.

The right of people to define their own policies and strategies for the sustainable production, distribution and consumption of food, with respect for their own cultures and their own systems of managing natural resources and rural areas, and is considered to be a precondition for food security.
Distant water fishing vessels or fishing vessels flying a foreign flag operating within the fishing zone of a coastal state.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Bateaux de pêche en haute mer ou bateaux de pêche battant pavillon étranger opérant à l'intérieur de la zone de pêche d'un Etat côtier.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Embarcaciones de pesca en aguas lejanas o embarcaciones de pesca que izan una bandera extranjera, que operan al interior de la zona de pesca de un estado ribereño.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Provisions that regulate and/or restrict the ownership of land, or other rights to land, by foreigners, foreign organisations or foreign companies.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Dispositions qui règlent ou/et limitent la propriété foncière, ou d'autres droits fonciers, pour les étrangers, les organisations et les sociétés étrangères.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Disposiciones que regulan y/o restringen la propiedad de la tierra u otros derechos sobre la misma por parte de ciudadanos, compañías y organizaciones extranjeras.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Forest-fires prevention and/or control, plans for forest-fire-prone zones, fire brigade, fire-breaks, watch-posts, regulation of authorised fires.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Prévention et contrôle des feux de forêts, plans pour les zones à risques d'incendie, coupe-feux, garde-feux, réglementation des feux autorisés.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Prevención y control de incendios forestales, planes para las zonas forestales con riesgo de incendio, bomberos, callejones cortaincendio, puestos de vigilancia, regulación de quemas autorizadas.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Forest conservation means all activities to preserve and rehabilitate forests, in particular activities designed to protect or restore the biological diversity and ecological functions of the forest ecosystem, while securing as far as possible their current and future value for mankind and in particular for forest-dependent people. Forest management means the management and use of forests and wooded lands in a way, and at a rate, that maintains their biological diversity, productivity, regeneration capacity, vitality and their potential to fulfill, now and in the future, relevant ecological, economic and social functions, at local, national, and global levels, without causing any damage to other ecosystems.
Authorities in charge of forest management and conservation.

A forest species is a species that forms part of a forest ecosystems or is dependent on a forest for part or all of its day-to-day living requirements or for its reproductive requirements. Therefore, an animal species may be considered a forest species even if it does not live most of its life in a forest.
Any action or measure aimed at prevention and control of damage to forests arising from human action/activity, wildlife, livestock, of pests and abiotic agents.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Framework laws are laws used to legislate on multisectoral matters in a consistent, coordinated and comprehensive fashion, laying down general principles and obligations while leaving the details to lower-level laws and giving the competent authorities the power to define the necessary measures within the framework established by law.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; PL; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Fraudulent practices involving food may be reduced to the following types of offenses: deceit, adulteration, sale of adulterated food and the sale of spoiled food or otherwise unfit for human consumption. Their common characteristic is that they imply in principle bad faith on the part of the person committing the offence.;Adulteration of food consists in its alteration with intent to deceive, e.g., the addition of unauthorized substances, the unlawful removal of nutritive principles or the substitution of ingredients (e.g., wine adulterated with methyl alcohol).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Les pratiques frauduleuses relatives aux denrées alimentaires peuvent être réduites aux types d'infractions suivants: tromperie, adultération, vente de denrées adultérées ou périmées ou non adaptés à la consommation humaine. Leur caractéristique commune est celle de comporter la mauvaise foi de la part de la personne qui commet l'infraction.;L'adultération des denrées alimentaires consiste en leur altération avec l'intention de tromper, par exemple, en ajoutant des substances non autorisées, en éliminant illégalement des principes nutritifs ou en substituant des ingrédients (ex. vin adultéré avec de l'alcool méthylique).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Las prácticas fraudulentas que interesan los productos alimenticios se pueden reducir a los siguientes delitos: engaño, adulteración, venta de alimentos adulterados, comercialización de alimentos estropeados o cualquier otro tipo de producto alimenticio no apto para el consumo humano. La característica común de estos delitos es que conllevan la mala fe de parte de la persona que lo comete.;La adulteración de un producto alimenticio consiste en su alteración con la intención de engañar. Por ejemplo, la adición de sustancias no autorizadas, la extracción ilegal de los principios nutritivos o la substitución de ingredientes (por ejemplo, vino adulterado con alcohol metílico).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: Le consentement préalable, donné librement et en connaissance de cause (CPLCC)
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Free, Prior and Informed Consent (FPIC) is a specific right that pertains to indigenous peoples and is recognised in the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP). It allows them to give or withhold consent to a project that may affect them or their territories. Once they have given their consent, they can withdraw it at any stage. Furthermore, FPIC enables them to negotiate the conditions under which the project will be designed, implemented, monitored and evaluated. This is also embedded within the universal right to self-determination.
Carps, barbels and other cyprinids. Tilapia and other cichilds. Miscellaneous freshwater fishes.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Carpes, barbeaux et autres cyprinidés. Tilaia et autres cichilides. Poissons d'eau douces divers.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Carpas, barbos y otros peces de la familia de los cyprinus. Tilapias y otros cichilidos. Diversos peces de agua dulce.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: pollution des eaux douces/qualité des eaux douces
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: calidad de las aguas dulces/contaminación de las aguas dulces
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: جودة المياه العذبة / تلوث المياه العذبة
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The quality of surface water in rivers and streams, lakes, ponds and wetlands is determined by interactions with soil, transported solids (organics, sediments), rocks, groundwater and the atmosphere. It may also be significantly affected by agricultural, industrial, mineral and energy extraction, urban and other human actions, as well as by atmospheric inputs.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La qualité des eaux de surface des fleuves, rivières, lacs, étangs et terrains marécageux est déterminée par les interactions avec le sol, les matières solides transportées (sédiments, solides organiques), les roches, les nappes phréatiques et l'atmosphère. Elle peut aussi être touchée par les activités agricoles, industrielles, les opérations minières et celles relatives à l'énergie, les activités humaines urbaines et autres, aussi bien que par les apports atmosphériques.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La calidad de las aguas superficiales de ríos y corrientes, lagos, estanques y humedales es el resultado de su interacción con el suelo, que aporta sólidos orgánicos y sedimentos, las rocas, las aguas subterráneas y la atmósfera. También puede ser afectada considerablemente por las actividades agrícolas, industriales, minerales y de extracción de energía, urbanas y antrópicas, así como por factores atmosféricos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Wood in the rough (such as chips, sawdust and pellets) used for energy generation.
Game is any animal hunted for sport or for food and the meat of those animals.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the social, economic and cultural roles and relations between women and men, taking into account their different access to and control over the resources, as well as their responsibilities in a given culture or location and in different population groups (children, aged people, ethnic groups, socio-economic, etc.)

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Genetic resources means genetic material of actual or potential value; genetic material means any material of plant, animal, microbial or other origin containing functional units of heredity.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The modification of the genetic characteristics of a microorganism, plant or animal by inserting a modified gene or a gene from another variety or species.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La modification des charactéristiques génétiques d’un microorganisme, végétal ou animal par l’introduction d’un gène modifié ou d’un gène provenant d’une autre variété ou espèce.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La modificación de las características genéticas de un microorganismo, planta o animal mediante la introducción de un gene modificado o de un gene proveniente de otra variedad o especie.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A good practice is a process or methodology that is ethical, fair, and replicable, has been shown to work well, succeeds in achieving its objective(s), and therefore can be recommended as a model.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Governance refers to the complex mechanisms, processes, relationships and institutions through which authorities, citizens and groups articulate their interests, exercise their rights and obligations and mediate their differences.
Grazing is land where farm animals feed on grass.
Groundwater is the water present beneath Earth's surface in soil pore spaces and in the fractures of rock formations.

dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 危害分析与关键控制点
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: HACCP is a management system in which food safety is addressed through the analysis and control of biological, chemical, and physical hazards from raw material production, procurement and handling, to manufacturing, distribution and consumption of the finished product.
A place on the coast where ships may moor in shelter, especially one protected from rough water by piers, jetties, and other artificial structures.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EN; LA; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A substance which by reason of its chemical or physical properties, and based on technical, scientific and medical evidence, is determined to cause, or likely to cause through its handling, harm to human health or the environment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; LA; MR; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Waste which is poisonous, corrosive, irritant, noxious, explosive, inflammable, toxic or harmful to the environment.
A book recording the pedigrees of cattle, goats, or other livestock.

All parts of the sea that are not included in the exclusive economic zone, in the territorial sea or in the internal waters of a State, or in the archipelagic waters of an archipelagic State (United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, article 86).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toutes les parties de la mer qui ne sont comprises ni dans la zone économique exclusive, la mer territoriale ou les eaux intérieures d'un Etat, ni dans les eaux archipélagiques d'un Etat archipel (Article 86 de la Convention des Nations Unies sur le droit de la mer).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Todas las partes del mar no incluidas en la zona económica exclusiva, en el mar territorial o en las aguas interiores de un Estado, ni en las aguas archipelágicas de un Estado archipelágico (Convención de las Naciones Unidas sobre el Derecho del Mar, art. 86).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An artificial form of a natural chemical substance that is used for treating particular medical conditions, some of which may increase muscular development.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Human rights are universal values and legal guarantees that protect individuals and groups against actions and omissions primarily by State agents that interfere with fundamental freedoms, entitlements and human dignity. The full spectrum of human rights involves respect for, and protection and fulfilment of, civil, cultural, economic, political and social rights, as well as the right to development. Human rights are universal— in other words, they belong inherently to all human beings—and are interdependent and indivisible.
An authorization to the bearer to hunt wild animals or game.

dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: плата за разрешение на охоту/охотничий билет
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A charge related to authorizations or services provided by a public authority in relation to hunting activities.
Tools, techniques, means, methods or equipment (modern or traditional) used to hunt.
Means a right/prerogative to hunt or allow the hunting of the wildlife on a land/area
Activity designed for the capture of any wild game species, dead or alive.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Activité visant à la capture de toute espèce de gibier, vivant ou mort.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Actividad destinada a la captura de toda clase de animal selvático, muerto o vivo.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Hydroelectric power, also called hydropower, electricity produced from generators driven by turbines that convert the potential energy of falling or fast-flowing water into mechanical energy.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; FI; FD; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Relates to all measures necessary to ensure the safety and wholesomeness of animals/animal products and food. These measures cover all stages after primary production up to supply to the consumer.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à toutes les mesures nécessaires à assurer la sécurité et l'intégrité des animaux/produits animaux et des aliments. Ces mesures sont inhérentes à toutes les étapes successives à la production de base jusqu'à la livraison au consommateur.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a toda medida necesaria para garantizar la seguridad e integridad de animales, productos animales y productos alimenticios. Estas medidas incluyen todas las etapas: desde la producción de base hasta el abastecimiento al consumidor.

dictionary_term.Name_en_US: Illegal unreported and unregulated fishing (IUU fishing)
dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: Pêche illicite, non déclarée et non réglementée (INN)
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: Pesca ilegal, no declarada y no reglamentada (pesca INDNR)
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: الصيد غير القانوني دون إبلاغ ودون تنظيم
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 非法、不报告和不管制（IUU）捕鱼
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated (IUU) fishing is a broad term which includes: • Fishing and fishing-related activities conducted in contravention of national, regional and international laws. • Non-reporting, misreporting or under-reporting of information on fishing operations and their catches. • Fishing by “Stateless” vessels. • Fishing in convention areas of Regional Fisheries Management Organizations (RFMOs) by non-party vessels. • Fishing activities which are not regulated by States and cannot be easily monitored and accounted for.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; WA; WB; GE
