dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: People whose ancestors inhabited a place or a country when persons from another culture or ethnic background arrived on the scene and dominated them through conquest, settlement, or other means and who today live more in conformity with their own social, economic, and cultural customs and traditions than those of the country of which they now form a part (also referred to as “native,” “aboriginal,” or “tribal” peoples).

Water used for industrial purposes such as manufacturing, processing, washing, and cooling. Includes such industries as steel, chemical and allied products, paper and allied products, mining, and petroleum refining.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: L'eau utilisée à des fins industrielles telles que la fabrication, le traitement, le lavage et le refroidissement. Inclut l'industrie sidérurgique, chimique et les produits dérivés, l'industrie du papier et dérivés, l'exploitation minière et le raffinage du pétrole.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Uso del agua con fines industriales tales como la fabricación, procesamiento, lavado y refrigeración. Incluye el uso del agua en industrias del acero, químicas y de productos afines, del papel y productos afines, minería y refinerías.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An estate or property which a person has by descent, as heir to another.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Un fonds ou une propriété qu'une personne a par descendance, comme héritier d'une autre personne.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Un predio o propiedad que una persona ha recibido de otra como herencia.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to freshwater or brackish water fisheries as opposed to marine fisheries.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce terme se réfère à la pêche en eau douce ou saumâtre par opposition aux pêches maritimes.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a la pesca en agua dulce o salobre, en contraposición a la pesca marítima.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Non-saline and brackish water bodies inland from the coastal zone.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Innovations include the creation of new products and processes, the application of new products in other domains, or the enhancement of the routines and procedures associated with these applications.
A class of the Arthropoda typically having a segmented body with an external, chitinous covering, a pair of compound eyes, a pair of antennae, three pairs of mouthparts, and two pairs of wings.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Examination of a product design, product, process or installation and determination of its conformity with specific requirements or, on the basis of professional judgement, with general requirement.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A structure of social order governing the behaviour of a set of individuals and that shape human interactions by serving collectively valued goals. The term includes formal institutions (e.g. public institutions, non-governmental and private organizations, training and educational institutions such as universities and research institutes) and informal institutions (e.g. village committees, community groups, farmer groups). Informational institutions are in the forefront of organic agriculture development.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A continuous process through which decisions are made for the sustainable use, development, and protection of areas and resources. Integrated management acknowledges the relationships that exist among different uses and the environments they potentially affect. It is designed to overcome the fragmentation inherent in a sectoral approach, analyses the implications of development, conflicting uses, and promotes linkages and harmonization among various activities.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: gestion intégrée du risque phytosanitaire/stratégie phytosanitaire
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: manejo integrado de plagas/estrategias de manejo de plagas
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: المكافحة المتكاملة للآفات / استراتيجيات إدارة الآفات
dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: интегрированное управление пестицидами ИУП/стратегии борьбы с вредителями
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 综合虫害管理-IPM /虫害治理策略
dictionary_term.French_Variants: stratégie phytosanitaire/gestion intégrée du risque phytosanitaire
dictionary_term.Spanish_Variants: estrategias de manejo de plagas/manejo integrado de plagas
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A strategy for the management or eradication of a particular pest or pests. Integrated Pest Management is defined as a combination of processes where the use of chemical plant protection products is limited to the necessary minimum, and priority consideration given to biological and biotechnological measures, as well as to other cropping and growth technologies. Relates to plant protection programmes and integrated pest control/management strategies at the national, regional or territorial level, as well as to plant protection barriers, plant protection coordination and advisory bodies.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La stratégie de gestion du risque phytosanitaire est une stratégie, approuvée législativement, pour la gestion ou l'éradication d'un (ou plusieurs) organisme nuisible déterminé. La gestion intégrée du risque phytosanitaire est définie comme un ensemble de processus pour lesquels l'utilisation de produits chimiques concourant à la protection des végétaux est limitée au minimum nécessaire et la priorité est donnée aux mesures biologiques et de biotechnologie aussi bien qu'à d'autres technologies de culture et de croissance. Ce terme se réfère aux programmes de protection des végétaux et aux stratégies intégrées de lutte et de gestion phytosanitaire au niveau national, régional et local, aussi bien qu'aux barrières pour la protection des végétaux, aux organismes consultatifs et de coordination chargés de la protection des végétaux.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Manejo integrado de plagas (MIP) es una estrategia, aprobada por ley, para el manejo o erradicación de una determinada plaga o enfermedad. El MIP se define como una combinación de procesos en la que el recurso a productos químicos para la protección vegetal viene limitado al mínimo necesario, dando prioridad a las medidas biológicas y biotecnológicas, así como a otras técnicas de cultivo y crecimiento. Se refiere a los programas de protección vegetal y a las estrategias para el control y/o manejo integrado de plagas a nivel nacional, regional o local, así como también a las barreras de protección vegetal y a la coordinación y supervisión de la protección vegetal.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Intellectual property rights allow the creators – or owners of patents, trademarks or copyrighted works – to benefit from their own work or investment in a creation.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The exchange of domestic goods and services within the boundaries of a country.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Use for every national text that puts an international agreement into effect. For some countries, international agreements have no effect in national law unless they are explicitly transformed into a law by the national legislation.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: A utiliser pour tout texte national qui met en exécution un accord. Pour certains pays les accords internationaux n'ont aucun effet s'ils ne sont pas transformés explicitement en une loi nationale.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se usa para todo texto nacional que pone en vigor un acuerdo internacional. En algunos países, un acuerdo internacional no se hace efectivo a menos que se transforme previa y explícitamente en ley nacional mediante un acto legislativo.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Used exclusively to classify texts of international agreements, either separate or as part of national legislation. May also refer to agreements to which both States and international organizations are party.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Terme utilisé exclusivement pour classifier les accords internationaux, soit séparément soit comme partie d'une loi nationale. Peut aussi se référer aux accords où les parties sont des Etats et des organisations internationales.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se usa exclusivamente para clasificar el texto de acuerdos internacionales, sea separados que como parte de legislación nacional. También se puede referir a los acuerdos entre Estados y organizaciones internacionales.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: International cooperation refers to processes of policy coordination by which states and other entities (such as multinational corporations or nongovernmental organizations) adjust their behavior to the actual or anticipated preferences of other States, or of entities based in other countries.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Includes any bilateral, subregional, regional, multilateral or global organizations. Includes also regional fisheries commissions.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Incluses les organisations régionales, bilatérales ou multilatérales, les organismes régionaux de pêche, les commissions ou comités de pêche, les organismes bilatéraux et régionaux pour la gestion et la protection des rivières internationales, des lacs et des plans d'eau souterrains.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye todo organismo bilateral, subregional, regional, multilateral o mundial, y las comisiones regionales de pesca.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: International trade is the exchange of goods and services between countries.

Invasive alien species are plants, animals, pathogens and other organisms that are non-native to an ecosystem, and which may cause economic or environmental harm or adversely affect human health. In particular, they impact adversely upon biodiversity, including decline or elimination of native species - through competition, predation, or transmission of pathogens - and the disruption of local ecosystems and ecosystem functions.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Présence d'une espèce dans une aire qui n'est pas son aire naturelle, résultant d'une action humaine accidentelle ou intentionnelle qui a donné lieu à cette dispersion. Ce terme comprend aussi toute part, gamètes ou autre matériel biologique capable de propager l'espèce. On utilise aussi le terme "espèces non-indigènes".
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Especies que se encuentran en un lugar distinto al de su área natural como resultado de su introducción, fruto de una actividad humana intencional o accidental. El término incluye organismos o sus partes, gametos, o cualquier tipo de material biológico capaz de propagarse como especie. También incluye especies no indígenas y especies exóticas.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An itemized list of current assets, resources, goods or materials.
Artificial application of water to assist in the growing of crops (and pastures).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EN; FD; LA; SE; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Power or right of a legal or political agency to exercise its authority over a person, subject matter, or territory.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Human beings as factors of production. The labour supply consists of all those able and willing to work, including the self-employed and unemployed as well as employed workers. On a farm, usually it is broadly classified into operator's labour, family labour and hired labour.
Credit or loan in which an immovable property is used as a guarantee for the repayment. Mortgages, hypothecation, liens, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Crédit ou prêt dans lequel un immeuble est utilisé comme garantie de remboursement. Hypothèques, privilèges, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Crédito o préstamo en el que se utiliza un inmueble como garantía para el reembolso. Hipotecas, gravámenes, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Land clearing is the removal of native vegetation for agricultural purposes and other developmental projects.
These are formally-constituted bodies that investigate land-related issues, or implement some aspect of land policy, such as adjudication.
Type of land reform whereby parcels of land are reshaped and/or redistributed to achieve a more efficient (agricultural) use. Including re-allotment.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Type de réforme foncière où des lots de terre sont réorganisés et/ou redistribués pour obtenir une utilisation agricole plus efficace. Comprend le re-lotissement.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Tipo de reforma agraria que procede a la reorganización y/o redistribución de la tierra con el fin de lograr un uso agrícola más eficiente. Incluye la relotización.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The redistribution of land to the rural poor for equity and agricultural efficiency purposes.
Refers to the splitting up of land into usable or buildable plots. Includes partition of land for the purpose of selling or planning.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à la subdivision des terres en lots utilisables ou édificables. Comprend la subdivision foncière pour raisons de vente ou de planification.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a la división de tierras en predios utilizables o edificables. Incluye la subdivisión de la tierra por motivos de venta o planificación.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Land tenure refers to the relationship (whether defined under formal de jure law or under customary law) that individuals and groups hold with respect to land and related resources. Land tenure rules define the ways in which property rights to land are allocated, transferred, used, or managed in a particular society. For our purposes, land is used here to include most fixed natural resources associated with land (e.g., trees, minerals, pasture, water); in essence, all land-based resources.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Terme général qui se réfère au droit et au mode de détention des terres. Il comprend la propriété, la location, la tenure coutumière (droits traditionnels/coutumiers) et les droits d'usage.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Palabra clave general que se refiere al derecho o modalidad de la tenencia de tierras. Incluye propiedad, alquiler, tenencia consuetudinaria (derechos tradicionales y consuetudinarios) y derechos de usufructo.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Assessment of value of land for taxation purposes, valuers' committees, compensation for expropriation.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Evaluation de la valeur des fonds à des fins de taxation, comités d'évaluation, indemnités d'expropriation.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Avalúo catastral con fines fiscales, comisiones de avalúo, indemnizaciones por motivos de expropiación.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The systematic assessment of land and water potential, alternative patterns of land use and other physical, social and economic conditions, for the purpose of selecting and adopting the land-use options that are the most beneficial to land users without degrading the resources or the environment, together with the selection of measures most likely to encourage such land uses.
The movement of fish and fishery products in any form from a vessel to dockside in a port or free-trade zone, even if subsequently transferred to another vessel.
A contract granting use or occupation of property during a specified period in exchange for a specified rent.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An administrative proceeding is a non-judicial determination of fault or wrongdoing and may include, in some cases, penalties of various forms. They are typically conducted by government or military institutions. Legal proceeding: Action or procedure instituted in a court of law to acquire a benefit, interest, or right or to enforce a remedy.

Less-favoured area (LFA) is a term used to describe an area with natural handicaps (lack of water, climate, short crop season and tendencies of depopulation), or that is mountainous or hilly, as defined by its altitude and slope.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Liability - A comprehensive legal term that describes the condition of being actually or potentially subject to a legal obligation. Compensation is the the act or state of compensating, as by rewarding someone for service or by making up for someone's loss, damage, or injury by giving the injured party an appropriate benefit.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: utilisation de l'eau par le bétail
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Livestock water use is water associated with livestock watering, feedlots, dairy operations, and other on-farm needs. Livestock includes dairy cows and heifers, beef cattle and calves, sheep and lambs, goats, hogs and pigs, horses, and poultry. Other livestock water uses include cooling of facilities for the animals and products, dairy sanitation and wash down of facilities, animal waste-disposal systems, and incidental water losses. The livestock category excludes on-farm domestic use, lawn and garden watering, and irrigation water use.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Level of administration below the national government within a particular sovereign state, geographically localised and with limited powers (e.g. county councils, borough councils, municipalities, departments, districts).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Niveau d'administration inférieur au gouvernement national dans un État souverain particulier, géographiquement localisé et doté de pouvoirs limités (par exemple, les municipalités, les départements, les districts).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Dentro de un Estado soberano, nivel de administración por debajo del gobierno nacional, geográficamente localizado y con poderes limitados (por ejemplo municipios, departamentos, distritos).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any kind of provision and measure for the management and conservation of natural resources, e.g. forests, protected areas, coastal resources.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toute mesure de gestion et/ou de conservation des ressources naturelles, par exemple les forêts, les zones protégées, les ressources côtières.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cualquier tipo de medidas de ordenación y/o conservación de recursos naturales, por ejemplo, bosques, áreas protegidas, recursos costeros.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Cultivation, management and harvesting of marine organisms in the sea, in specially constructed rearing facilities e.g. cages, pens and long-lines.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EG; EN; LA; MR; SE; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Area relating to or found in the sea.;
The industry or occupation devoted to the catching, harvesting, processing, or selling of fish, shellfish, or other aquatic animals in marine areas.
Marine fishes are the fishes that live in ocean water.
Marine mammals are aquatic mammals that rely on the ocean and other marine ecosystems for their existence.
Provisions on the protection of (or prohibitions concerning) the marine environment from pollution.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Dispositions relatives à la protection (ou aux prohibitions concernant) de l'environnement maritime contre la pollution.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Disposiciones destinadas a la protección (o prohibición) del ambiente marino de la contaminación.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Marine Protected Areas (MPAs) involve the protective management of natural marine areas according to pre-defined management objectives. MPAs can be conserved for a number of reasons including economic resources, biodiversity conservation, and species protection. They are created by delineating zones with permitted and non-permitted uses within that zone.

The maritime zones recognized under international law include internal waters, the territorial sea, the contiguous zone, the exclusive economic zone, the continental shelf, the high seas and the Area. With the exception of the high seas and the Area, each of these maritime zones is measured from the baseline determined in accordance with customary international law as reflected in the 1982 Law of the Sea Convention.
Application of marks, ear tags or other means of identification to animals. Tree marking for specific purposes (trade, sale, harvest).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Marquage, marques auriculaires ou autres systèmes d'identification des animaux. Procédure d'identification et de martelage d'arbres pour des fins spécifiques (commerce, vente, coupe).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Aplicación de marcas, anillos u otro tipo de señas de identificación para animales. Marcado de árboles para diversos fines (comercio, venta, tala).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The flesh of animals (including fishes and birds and snails) used as food.
Any plant whose roots, leaves, seeds, bark, or plant part is used for therapeutic, tonic, purgative, or other health-promoting purposes.
Refers to provisions regulating the size of a fishing net mesh and the method by which it shall be measured.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce terme se réfère aux dispositions réglementant la taille du maillage des filets de pêche et les méthodes à adopter pour la mesurer.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a las disposiciones que regulan la dimensión de la malla de las redes de pesca y el procedimiento para realizar su medición.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The movement of a person or a group of persons, either across an international border, or within a State. It is a population movement, encompassing any kind of movement of people, whatever its length, composition and causes; it includes migration of refugees, displaced persons, economic migrants, and persons moving for other purposes, including family reunification (IOM, 2011).

Any species or lower taxon of wild animals, in which a significant proportion of the members of the entire population or any geographically separate part of the population cyclically and predictably crosses one or more national jurisdictional boundaries.

Dairy products or milk products are a type of food produced from or containing the milk of mammals. They are primarily produced from mammals such as cattle, water buffaloes, goats, sheep, camels and humans. Dairy products include food items such as yogurt, cheese and butter.
Water from a mineral spring that contains various minerals, such as salts and sulfur compounds.
A naturally occurring, inorganic, solid, crystalline substance which has a fixed structure and a chemical composition which is either fixed or which may vary within certain defined limits.
The extraction of valuable minerals or other geological materials from the earth, usually from an orebody, lode, vein, seam, reef or placer deposit.
Class of animals with soft bodies (and often hard shells), e.g. oysters, mussels, cuttlefish, snails, slugs.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Une classe d'animaux au corps mou (et souvent à coquille dure), par exemple: les huîtres, les moules, la seiche, les escargots, les limaces.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Una clase de animales de cuerpo blando y, frecuentemente, de concha dura, por ejemplo, ostras, mejillones, jibias, caracoles, babosas.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Monitoring is a periodically recurring task already beginning in the planning stage of a project or programme. Monitoring allows results, processes and experiences to be documented and used as a basis to steer decision-making and learning processes. Monitoring is checking progress against plans. The data acquired through monitoring is used for evaluation.;

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FD; FO; LA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Land area that rises prominently above its surroundings, generally exhibiting steep slopes, a relatively confined summit area, and considerable local relief. Mountains generally are understood to be larger than hills, but the term has no standardized geological meaning.

The maximum concentration of residue resulting from the use of a veterinary drug or a pesticide that is recommended by the Codex Alimentarius Commission to be legally permitted or recognized as acceptable in or on a food.

Protected area managed mainly for ecosystem protection and recreation. National parks are relatively large areas, which contain representative samples of major natural regions, features or scenery, where plant and animal species, geomorphological sites, and habitats are of special scientific, educational and recreational interest. The area is managed and developed so as to sustain recreation and educational activities on a controlled basis. The area and visitors ‘use are managed at a level which maintains the area in a natural or semi-natural state.
Flammable gas, consisting largely of methane and other hydrocarbons, occurring naturally underground (often in association with petroleum) and used as fuel.
Right/freedom of navigation, innocent/transit passage, including ports and harbours navigation regulations.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Droit de navigation, liberté de navigation, passage innocent, passage transitoire, inclus les ports et les règles de navigation portuaire.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Derecho de navegación, libertad de navegación, paso inocente, paso de tránsito, incluye regulaciones sobre la navegación en puertos y radas.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Pollution generating from harmful or unwanted sounds.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Pollution générée par des sources nuisibles ou non désirées.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Contaminación generada por sonidos peligrosos e indeseados.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Includes recreational, sport, non-commercial and self-supporting fishing.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Y compris la pêche de plaisance, sportive, non- commerciale et de subsistance.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye la pesca de recreación, deportiva, no comercial y la de subsistencia.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Includes: animal by-products, animal products industry, wool, feathers, leather.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Inclut: les sous-produits d'origine animale, l'industrie des produits d'origine animale, la laine, le cuir.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye los subproductos de origen animal, la industria de productos de origen animal, la lana y el cuero.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any organization, commercial or non-commercial, which is independent from government, such as associations, companies, joint ventures, users' organizations.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toutes organisations, avec ou sans but lucratif, indépendantes de l'Etat, telles que les associations, les sociétés, les coentreprises, les associations d'usagers.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cualquier organización independiente del gobierno, con o sin finalidad comercial, como por ejemplo, asociaciones, compañías, joint ventures y asociaciones de usuarios.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Non-timber forest products (NTFPs) are any product or service other than timber that is produced in forests. They include fruits and nuts, vegetables, fish and game, medicinal plants, resins, essences and a range of barks and fibres such as bamboo, rattans, and a host of other palms and grasses.
Novel food is defined as a type of food that does not have a significant history of consumption or is produced by a method that has not previously been used for food.
Energy released by reactions within atomic nuclei, as in nuclear fission or fusion.
The intake of food, and the interplay of biological, social, and economic processes that influence the growth, function and repair of the body.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 违反法律规定/处罚或制裁
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any kind of violation of the provisions provided for by law. Penalties/sanctions for any kind of violation of the provisions provided for by law.
A viscous liquid derived from petroleum, especially for use as a fuel or lubricant.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EN; LA; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Contamination of any ecosystem, but usually of freshwater or marine ecosystems, by oil or other petroleum products.
Includes cottonseed, flaxseed, peanuts, soybeans, sunflower, peppermint and spearmint, mint oil and olive oil, fats and oils.
a plant from which vegetable oil can be extracted from the fruit or seeds.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; LA; PL; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Waste of a biological origin such as paper and cardboard, food, green and garden waste, animal waste and biosolids and sludges.
The physical universe beyond the earth's atmosphere.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; FI; FO; LA; MR; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Ownership is the state or fact of exclusive rights and control over property, which may be any asset, including an object, land or real estate, intellectual property.
The layer of ozone in the atmosphere between 20 and 50 km above the surface of the Earth.

Refers to all aspects required by law with respect to packaging/re-packaging and labelling, such as: full details of product identification, composition, safety precaution, storage, instructions and summary of uses, warnings, provisions on packaging/recycling, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à toutes les informations requises par la loi, et devant apparaître sur les emballages/réemballages et les étiquettes, comme notamment: détails complets pour l'identification du produit, composition, précautions de sûreté, stockage, instructions et modes d'emploi, avertissements, dangers potentiels, et aux dispositions sur l'emballage/recyclage, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a todas las normas obligatorias en materia de empaquetado y etiquetado, tales como: identificación detallada y completa del producto, composición, precauciones en tema de seguridad, almacenamiento, instrucciones para el uso, advertencias, disposiciones en materia de empaquetado/reciclado, etc.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FO; LA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Pastoralism refers to livestock-based livelihood and food systems relying on seasonal mobility of animals and people within and across borders.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.Name_en_US: payments for ecosystem services/ payment for environmental services (PES)
dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: rémunération des services des écosystèmes/Paiement des services environnementaux
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: pago por servicios ecosistémicos/pago por servicios ambientales
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: الدفع مقابل خدمات النظم الإيكولوجية / الدفع مقابل الخدمات البيئية
dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: плата за экосистемные услуги/плата за экологические услуги
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 生态系统服务补偿/环境服务付费
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Payments for ecosystem services (PES) occur when a beneficiary or user of an ecosystem service makes a direct or indirect payment to the provider of that service. The idea is that whoever preserves or maintains an ecosystem service should be paid for doing so.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any substance intended for preventing, destroying, attracting, repelling, or controlling any pest including unwanted species of plants or animals during the production, storage, transport, distribution and processing of food, agricultural commodities, or animal feeds or which may be administered to animals for the control of ectoparasites.

Pests are destructive insects or other animals that attacks crops, food, livestock, etc. Disease is a deviation from the state of complete physical or social well-being of an organism involving a well-defined set of symptoms and etiology, and leading to an impairment of its normal function.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FO; LA; PL; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: ICP-procedimiento de información y consentimiento previos
dictionary_term.Spanish_Variants: Procedimiento de información y consentimiento previos
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: In the context of Access Benefit Sharing and the Nagoya Protocol, PIC refers to the administrative permit given by the competent national authority of a provider country to a user, prior to accessing genetic resources. In the context of the Rotterdam Convention, a PIC procedure is established to ensure that restricted hazardous chemicals are not exported to countries that do not wish to receive them.

The plant production system encompassing the basic genetic and physiological regulations on plant growth, the impact on growth of soil, water, nutrients, disease and pests and the influence of management processes.

Preventing, destroying or controlling any pest causing harm during or otherwise interfering with the production, processing, storage, transport or marketing of food, agricultural commodities, wood and wood products.

A plant grouping, within a single botanical taxon of the lowest known rank, defined by the reproducible expression of its distinguishing and other genetic characteristics. A variety may be represented by seed, transplants, plants, tubers, tissue culture plantlets, and other forms.
Planting material means any part of the plant that can be used for reproduction. Seeds - the unit of reproduction of a flowering plant, capable of developing into another such plant.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Semences et matériel de propagation du point de vue agronomique. La semence peut être définie comme la partie de la plante destinée à la propagation. Sont inclus: les semences, les banque de semences; le matériel génétique, la germination, les pépinières, les stocks des pépinières; les produits pour nettoyer les semences; les semences certifiées/sujettes à restrictions/prescrites/génétiques/de base/d'obtenteur; les semences résistantes aux parasites/maladies; les semences ayant subi un traitement chimique; les établissements de multiplication des semences, les terrains et les industries de production de semences, les serres; les matériels de propagation pour la croissance et la reproduction des végétaux (par exemple, les bulbes, les racines tubéreuses, les racines, les tissus, les boutures, les greffons, les stocks, etc.); les techniques et opérations de greffage; les pousses.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Semillas y materiales de propagación desde el punto de vista agrícola. Se puede definir la semilla como la parte de la planta usada para su propagación. Incluye semillas, bancos de semillas, germoplasma, germinación, viveros, reservas de semillas, centros para la multiplicación de semillas, producción artesanal e industrial de semillas, invernaderos, materiales de propagación para la reproducción y crecimiento de plantas (por ejemplo, bulbos, túberos, raíces, etc).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FD; LA; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A synthetic material made from a wide range of organic polymers.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Policy is the course of action for an undertaking adopted by a government, a person or another party. Instruments that exist to support policy and tools used to achieve policy objectives include some or all of the following: societal instruments, economic and command-and-control instruments, direct government involvement and institutional and organizational arrangements. Planning is the plotting of a course of action (involving executive action or enforcement) which is proposed to carry-out some proceeding, devising the relative positions and timing of a set of actions.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EN; LA; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The principle that countries or private companies or even individuals should in some way compensate others for the effects of pollution that they (or their citizens) generate or have generated.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Pollution control is a term used in environmental management. It means the control of emissions and effluents into air, water or soil. Without pollution control, the waste products from overconsumption, heating, agriculture, mining, manufacturing, transportation and other human activities, whether they accumulate or disperse, will degrade the environment.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: mesures du ressort de l’État du port
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: medidas del Estado rector del puerto
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: As a tool to combat IUU fishing, Port State Measures (PSM) are requirements established or interventions undertaken by port states which a foreign fishing vessel must comply with or is subjected to as a condition for use of ports within the port state. National PSM would typically include requirements related to prior notification of port entry, use of designated ports, restrictions on port entry and landing/transhipment of fish, restrictions on supplies and services, documentation requirements and port inspections, as well as related measures, such as IUU vessel listing, trade-related measures and sanctions.
Relates to post-harvest procedures such as chemotherapy, fumigation, thermotherapy, as well as to specific products used for post-harvest purposes.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère aux procédés faisant suite à la récolte comme la chimiothérapie, la fumigation, la thermothérapie, aussi bien qu'au produits spécifiques utilisés après la récolte.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a los métodos de postcosecha tales como la quimioterapia, fumigación, tratamientos térmicos, así como los productos específicos usados para tales tratamientos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Water that is safe to drink or use for food preparation.
Domesticated birds such as chickens, ducks, turkeys and geese to produce meat, eggs for food, or feathers.
Poultry products means eggs, dressed poultry, eviscerated poultry, or frozenegg, liquid egg, or dried egg.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A pronounced deprivation of well-being related to lack of material income or consumption, low levels of education and health, vulnerability and exposure to risk, and voicelessness and powerlessness.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Principle adopted by the UN Conference on Environment and Development (1992) that in order to protect the environment, a precautionary approach should be widely applied, meaning that where there are threats of serious or irreversible damage to the environment, lack of full scientific certainty should not be used as a reason for postponing cost-effective measures to prevent environmental degradation.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Principe adopté par la conférence des NU sur l'environnement et le développement (1992), en base auquel une approche précautionnelle devrait être largement appliquée en vue de protéger l'environnement, et notamment, en cas de risque de dommages graves ou irréversibles, l’absence de certitude scientifique absolue ne doit pas être un prétexte pour remettre à plus tard des mesures effectives visant à prévenir ces dommages.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Principio adoptado por la Conferencia de las Naciones Unidas sobre Medio Ambiente y Desarrollo (1992) que, con la finalidad de proteger el medio ambiente, sugiere que se aplique ampliamente un enfoque precaucional; ello significa que allí donde existan riesgos de un daño grave o irreversible al medio ambiente, la falta de una absoluta certeza científica al respecto no debería ser utilizada como pretexto para posponer el establecimiento de medidas, eficaces en función del costo, destinadas a prevenir la degradación del medio ambiente.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Prescription is the manner of acquiring property by a long, honest, and uninterrupted possession or use during the time required by law. Adverse possession is a legal principle under which a person who does not have legal title to a piece of property — usually land — acquires legal ownership based on continuous possession or occupation of the property without the permission of its legal owner.
Rules on priorities for the allocation of a resource between different uses. This implies priority criteria.

Exploitation of a private forest, private ownership of a forest, compulsory measures limiting the property right (such as measures against fire and desertification, requiring reforestation ...), participation in consortia of forest owners, production orientation.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Exploitation de la forêt, propriété privée de la forêt, mesures obligatoires limitant les droits de propriété (telles que les mesures contre les incendies et la désertification, et pour la reforestation), participation à groupements de propriétaires forestiers, orientation de la production.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Explotación de bosques privados, propiedad privada de un bosque, medidas obligatorias que limitan el derecho de propiedad (tales como medidas contra incendios forestales y desertificación, exigencias de reforestación), participación en consorcios de propietarios forestales, orientación de la producción.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Land that is not owned by the government.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Set of actions that is the official, legal, or accepted way of doing something.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; MR; PL; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: All activities relating to production/processing/manufacturing/transforming cycle. This keyword also includes facilities and premises where products are handled and processed.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toute activité liée à la production/transformation/fabrication/cycle de transformation. Se réfère aux installations et établissements de production et de transformation.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Toda actividad relacionada con el ciclo de producción, procesamiento, fabricación, transformación. Esta palabra clave también incluye las instalaciones y locales donde se manipulan y procesan los productos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Includes crops that have been prohibited for different reasons (mainly for health reasons): coca, marihuana, opium, etc.

Property rights refer to a bundle of rights to use, control, and transfer assets, including land. These include the rights to occupy, enjoy, and use; to restrict others from entry or use; to dispose, buy, or inherit; to develop or improve; to cultivate; to sublet; to realize financial benefits; and to access services in association with land. Property rights can also include ideas and designs (copyrights, patents, and intellectual materials), as well as rights over “moveable property,” for example, cars, cows, mobile homes, and wildlife.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to any area specifically designated and delineated by law for protection purposes. The essence is that within the area, a special legal regime applies, including special restrictions and/or prohibitions.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à toute superficie spécifiquement désignée et délimitée par la loi pour des raisons de protection. Ce qui veut dire qu'à l'intérieur de cette superficie s'applique un régime juridique spécial, comprenant des restrictions et/ou des prohibitions spéciales.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a toda área específicamente establecida y delimitada por ley con fines de protección. El aspecto más relevante es que al interno de la área establecida se aplica un régimen especial que comporta restricciones y/o prohibiciones.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Protected forests subject to a particular legal regime, so declared in order to protect soil and water, stabilize steep slopes, maintain sustained yield of forest produce, conserve dry-zones and mangroves forests, conserve environment and biodiversity.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Forêts protégées régies par un régime juridique particulier, ainsi déclarées afin de protéger le sol et les eaux, de stabiliser les terrains en forte pente, de maintenir une récolte soutenable des produits forestiers, de conserver les zones arides et les forêts de mangroves, de conserver l'environnement et la diversité biologique.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Bosques protegidos por un régimen jurídico especial, declarados tales con el fin de proteger el suelo y el agua, de estabilizar terrenos pendientes, de mantener una producción forestal sostenible, de conservar zonas áridas y manglares y de conservar el medio ambiente y la biodiversidad.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental protection is the practice of protecting the natural environment by individuals, organizations and governments. Its objectives are to conserve natural resources and the existing natural environment and, where possible, to repair damage and reverse trends.;
Measures contributing to ensuring biodiversity within an an environment defined by specific biological and ecological factors
Measure taken to ensure the conservation of species.
Woodland and forest belonging to the State or to a local public entity, forest belonging to the public domain, forest estate, acquisition, delimitation, classified forest.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Terres boisées et forêts appartenant à l'Etat ou à une l'entité publique locale, forêt appartenant au domaine public, patrimoine forestier, acquisition, délimitation, forêt classée.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Tierras forestales y bosques que pertenecen al Estado o a la administración pública local, bosques demaniales, patrimonio forestal, adquisición, delimitación, bosques clasificados.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Public health means the health of individuals in the context of the wider health of the community.
Includes crown lands, national lands, State lands, government lands or a more general definition of the public domain related to land. Includes distribution, lease, sale, grants of, management, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Comprend les terres de la couronne, le domaine foncier national, de l'Etat ou du gouvernement, le domaine public. Inclut les dispositions relatives à la distribution, la location, les attributions, la gestion, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye las tierras reales, las tierras de la nación, los terrenos públicos, los terrenos de cualquier instancia gubernativa y, en general, las tierras demaniales. Incluye su distribución, alquiler, venta, concesión, manejo, etc.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The use of appropriate procedures for informing the public and in obtaining early and continuing participation in planning and decision making.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: PPP involves a contract between a public sector authority and a private party, in which the private party provides a public service or project and assumes substantial financial, technical and operational risk in the project.

Waters deemed by law to form part of the public domain, as opposed to private water. They might include the territorial sea, groundwaters, as well as waterways, rivers, lakes and other water resources considered of public interest.

Quarantine is defined as the official confinement of plants/animals subject to phytosanitary regulations for observation and research and for further inspection and/or testing. Quarantine regulations constitute a basic component of plant protection and animal health legislation and a form of State-organized measure to secure plant protection and animal health. Includes: plant/animal quarantine, inland quarantine, quarantine officers, harmful quarantine organisms and plants, the International Plant Quarantine Treatment Manual, detection and delimiting surveys, quarantine area, quarantine pest, quarantine treatments and procedures, quarantine station or facilities, post-entry quarantine, quarantine measures on custom-houses, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La quarantaine est définie comme étant l'ensemble des activités qui visent à prévenir l'introduction et/ou la dissémination d'organismes nuisibles ou à assurer leur éradication, ainsi que le confinement officiel de végétaux/animaux soumis à la réglementation phytosanitaire, pour contrôle et recherche, ou pour inspection et/ou analyses ultérieures. Les réglementations sur la quarantaine constituent un élément essentiel de la législation phytosanitaire et vétérinaire, et une forme de mesure officielle établie par l'Etat, pour assurer la protection des végétaux et de la santé animale. Sont inclus: la quarantaine végétale et animale, la quarantaine interne, les fonctionnaires de quarantaine, les organismes et végétaux nuisibles de quarantaine, le Manuel International pour le Traitement de Quarantaine Végétale, les prospections pour l'individuation et la délimitation, les zones de quarantaine, l'organisme de quarantaine, les traitements et procédures de quarantaine, les stations et bâtiments de quarantaine, la quarantaine successive à l'entrée, les mesures de quarantaine aux douanes, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se entiende por cuarentena el confinamiento oficial de plantas y animales, sujetos a reglamentaciones fitosanitarias, para su observación y examen, y para su ulterior inspección y/o análisis. Las reglamentaciones sobre la cuarentena constituyen un aspecto básico de la legislación sobre protección vegetal y sanidad animal, y una forma de procedimientos administrativos mediante la cual el Estado busca asegurar la protección sanitaria de plantas y animales. Incluye cuarentena vegetal y animal, cuarentena interna, personal oficial, organismos nocivos bajo cuarentena, el Manual Internacional para el Tratamiento Cuarentenal de Vegetales, detección y delimitación de los exámenes, el área cuarentenal, las plagas bajo cuarentena, los tratamientos y procedimientos cuarentenales, las estaciones y equipos para cuarentenas, la cuarentena posterior al ingreso, las medidas de cuarentena en las aduanas, etc.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Energy that comes from a source and travels through some material or through space. Light, heat and sound are types of radiation. Includes ionizing radiation (radioactivity), electromagnetic radiation (gamma rays, X-rays, and ultraviolet, light, infrared, and radio waves.)
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Energie provenant d'une source et se déplaçant à travers un certain matériau ou à travers l'espace. La lumière, la chaleur et le son sont des types de radiation. Ce terme comprend les rayonnements ionisants (radioactivité), les rayonnements électromagnétiques (rayons gamma, rayons-X et ultraviolets, la lumière, les infrarouges et les ondes radio).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Energía proveniente de una fuente y que viaja a través de algún material o del espacio. Luz, calor y sonido son clases de radiación. Incluye la radiación ionizante (radioactividad), radiación electromagnética (rayos gamma, rayos X, rayos ultravioleta, luz, infrarrojo y ondas de radio).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Water that has fallen as or been obtained from rain.

Ranching/captive breeding is the process of breeding/ranching wildlife outside of their natural habitat in restricted conditions such as fauna reserves, zoos and other conservation facilities (ex situ).
Provisions on cattle trails and transhumance ways. Lands subject to a right of grazing.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Dispositions relatives aux pistes pour le bétail et aux voies de transhumance. Terrains assujettis au droit de pâturage.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Disposiciones relativas a los caminos del ganado y a las vías para la trashumancia. Tierras sujetas al derecho de pastura.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Ratification defines the act whereby a State indicates its consent to be bound by a treaty. Acts of acceptance or approval of a treaty have the same legal effect as acts of ratification and consequently express the consent of a State to be bound by a treaty.
Area and percent of forest land managed for general recreation and tourism, in relation to the total area of forest land. Includes management of recreational forests, access.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Une zone ou une partie de terrain forestier aménagée à des fins récréatives ou de tourisme, par rapport à l'ensemble du terrain forestier. Inclut la gestion des forêts récréatives, l'accès.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Área y porcentaje de la totalidad de tierras forestales destinada a usos recreativos y turísticos. Incluye el acceso a bosques manejados como zonas de esparcimiento.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Provisions on water used for recreational purposes such as bathing or rafting in rivers, filling up of swimming pools, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Dispositions sur l'usage de l'eau à des fins récréatives telles que baignades ou rafting sur les fleuves, remplissage de piscines, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Disposiciones sobre el uso del agua con fines recreacionales como el baño, el rafting en ríos, las piscinas, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Process of converting material (especially waste) to a previous state so that it is a reusable material.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Registration is the process by which rights and interests are recorded in registers.

Energy sources that are, within a short time frame relative to the Earth’s natural cycles, sustainable, and include non-carbon technologies such as solar energy, hydropower, and wind, as well as carbon-neutral technologies such as biomass.
A vertebrate animal of a class that includes snakes, lizards, crocodiles, turtles, and tortoises. They are distinguished by having a dry scaly skin and typically laying soft-shelled eggs on land.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The study of a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new information or reach a new understanding.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; EN; FI; FD; MR; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Residual amounts of extraneous chemicals in organisms, goods or environment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EN; FD; LA; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Measurement and valuation of natural capital - the stock of renewable and non-renewable resources that yields a flow of benefits to people. Natural capital includes clean air, water, energy, food and raw materials, among others.

The right to use and/or harvest products from resources controlled by the State or owned by other persons. Rights of use are contemplated in special contracts such as lease, loan, usufruct, as well as in servitudes.

dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: derecho a un medio ambiente limpio/sano
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 享有清洁/健康环境的权利
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The right to a healthy environment brings together all that humanity has learned about how human rights and the environment interact. It encompasses the environmental dimensions of the rights to life, health, food, water, sanitation, property, private life, culture, and non-discrimination, among others.

The right to have regular, permanent and free access, either Directly or by means of financial purchases, to quantitatively and qualitatively adequate and sufficient food corresponding to the cultural traditions of the people to which the consumer belongs, and which ensures a physical and mental, individual and collective, fulfilling and dignified life free of fear.

The right to water entitles everyone to have access to sufficient, safe, acceptable, physically accessible and affordable water for personal and domestic use. It incorporates the right to sanitation entitling everyone to have physical and affordable access to sanitation, in all spheres of life, that is safe, hygienic, secure, and socially and culturally acceptable and that provides privacy and ensures dignity.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Risk assessment is the overall process of analysis and evaluation of a risk with regard to its impact and the likelihood of its being realized, and the selection of an appropriate risk response. Risk management is the process of identifying, selecting and implementing measures that can be applied to reduce the level of risk.
Institution or entity specifically created for the management and protection of rivers and their drainage basins.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Institution ou entité spécifiquement créée pour la gestion et la protection des fleuves et de leurs bassins de drainage.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Institución o entidad creada específicamente para la ordenación y protección de los ríos y de su área de captación.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A gnawing mammal of an order that includes rats, mice, squirrels, hamsters, porcupines, and their relatives, distinguished by strong constantly growing incisors and no canine teeth.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to any payment in the form of a fee, charge or royalty due in connection with any activity or service performed by a public or private authority, e.g., inspection process, application process to obtain an authorization, a licence or a permit, etc. Includes rate setting.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce mot clé se réfère à tout paiement sous forme de redevance, droit ou royalty du à une autorité publique ou privée en relation à une inspection, à une demande pour obtenir une autorisation, à une licence ou à un permis. Incluse la fixation des taux.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a cualquier tipo de pago que, bajo forma de tarifa, canon o derecho, se debe a una autoridad pública o privada por un servicio o actividad; por ejemplo, inspecciones, otorgamiento de una autorización, licencias o permisos, etc. Incluye la fijación del interés.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Rural employment refers to any activity, occupation, work, business or service performed by rural people for remuneration, profit, social or family gain, or by force, in cash or kind, including under a contract of hire, written or oral, expressed or implied, and regardless if the activity is performed on a self-directed, part-time, full-time or casual basis. Rural employment is comprised of agricultural employment, which includes both on-farm self-employment and wage employment in the agricultural sector, as well as non-agricultural employment, which includes non-farm self-employment and wage employment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; LA; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Identifies challenges, opportunities, objectives and activities focused on youth in rural areas

Saltwater intrusion is the movement of saline water into freshwater aquifers, which can lead to groundwater quality degradation, including drinking water sources, and other consequences. Siltation - Referring to the build up of silt (fine particles of soil, rock, mud, clay, dirt) that is suspended in rivers or other bodies of water.
Interventions that deliver a meal or snack to children in the school setting, with the intent of improving attendance, enrollment, nutritional status and learning outcomes.;
Period of time during which fishing or hunting of certain species in certain areas is allowed or prohibited.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Période pendant laquelle la pêche ou la chasse de certaines espèces dans certaines zones est admise ou interdite.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Período de tiempo durante el cual en áreas establecidas se prohibe o permite la pesca u caza de determinadas especies.

dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 在他人土地上的通行权(或类似的权力)
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A charge or burden upon one estate (servient estate) for the benefit or advantage of an estate belonging to another (dominant estate).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Contrainte qui s'impose sur un bien immobilier (le fonds servant), au profit d'un fonds appartenant à un autre propriétaire (le fonds dominant).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Gravamen real impuesto sobre un inmueble (predio sirviente) en beneficio de otro perteneciente a distinto dueño (predio dominante).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A system of drainage by sewers. Includes provisions on technical and hygienic standards.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Système de drainage par les égouts. Comprend les dispositions portant les normes hygiéniques et techniques.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Sistema de drenaje mediante alcantarillas. Incluye disposiciones sobre normas técnicas y sanitarias.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Are quadrupedal, ruminant mammals typically kept as livestock.
A minimum or maximum limit on the size of fish that may be legally caught.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Les dimensions limites maximales ou minimales d'un poisson pouvant être légalement pêché.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Límite máximo o mínimo de las medidas que un pez debe tener para que pueda ser legalmente pescado.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The killing or butchering of cattle, sheep, etc., especially for food.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A smallholding is a small farm. In third world countries, smallholdings are usually farms supporting a single family with a mixture of cash crops and subsistence farming. A Peasant is a poor smallholder or agricultural laborer of low social status.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A process of evaluating the likely impacts, both beneficial and adverse, of a proposed development that may affect the rights, which have an economic, social, cultural, civic and political dimension, as well as the well-being, vitality and viability, of an affected community – that is, the quality of life of a community as measured in terms of various socio-economic indicators, such as income distribution, physical and social integrity and protection of individuals and communities, employment levels and standards of housing and accommodation, infrastructure, services.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL; SE; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Social protection is a set of interventions whose objective is to reduce social and economic risk and vulnerability, and to alleviate extreme poverty and deprivation: social assistance, social insurance, labour market protection.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; MR; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Soil conservation is the protection of soil from erosion and other types of deterioration, so as to maintain soil fertility and productivity. It generally includes watershed management and water management. Soil improvement concerns in the first place the appropriate management of problem soils. It also involves the improvement of degraded soils in terms of soil prevention, mitigation, and rehabilitation.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; LA; MR; PL; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Soil pollution refers to the presence in the soil of a chemical or substance out of place and/or present at a higher than normal concentration that has adverse effects on any non-targeted organism. Soil quality refers to the soil's biological, chemical, and physical properties and processes and its capacity to perform essential ecosystem services.
It is used to refer to the re-establishment of soil ecosystem functions after these have been affected or impaired by land degradation.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; LA; SE; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any solid, semi-solid, or contained gaseous materials discarded from industrial, commercial, mining, or agricultural operations, and from community activities. Solid waste includes garbage, construction debris, commercial refuse, sludge from water supply or waste treatment plants, or air pollution control facilities, and other discarded materials.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Tout matériau solide, semi-solide ou à gaz contenu mis au rebut à la suite d'activités industrielles, commerciales, minières ou agricoles, ainsi que d'activités communautaires. Les déchets solides comprennent les ordures, les débris de construction, les déchets commerciaux, les boues provenant d'adduction d'eau ou d'usines de traitement des eaux, ou d'installations pour le contrôle de la pollution atmosphérique, ou autres matériaux de rebut.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Todo tipo de material de desecho sólido, semisólido o que contiene gases proveniente de actividades industriales, comerciales, mineras o agrícolas, así como residuos urbanos. Los residuos sólidos incluyen basura, escombros de construcción, rechazos industriales, fangos provenientes del abastecimiento hídrico o desperdicios del tratamiento de plantas, o instalaciones de control para la contaminación del aire y otros materiales de desecho.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Authority of a political state subject to no higher power, expressed within its territory in full self-government.
Foods prepared to meet the particular nutritional needs of persons whose normal processes of assimilation or metabolism are modified, or who require a controlled intake of food or certain nutrients.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any fund that is established for a specific purpose (e.g. food security fund, pest management strategies, land improvement fund, aquaculture development fund, land acquisition fund, etc.).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Tout fonds qui est établi dans un but spécifique, par exemple, fonds de développement pour les communautés natives/indigènes, la production végétale, les fonds pour les stratégies nationales et régionales pour la gestion du risque phytosanitaire, le fonds pour les calamités naturelles comme les sécheresses et les inondations; les fonds de développement pour la pêche et l'aquaculture, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Todo tipo de fondo que se establece para una finalidad específica (por ejemplo, para la seguridad alimentaria, para la gestión del riego fitosanitario, para el mejoramiento de tierras, para el desarrollo de la acuicultura, para la adquisición de tierras, etc.).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Provisions establishing requirements against which natural resources and products must conform. Standards may be "compulsory" or "recommended"
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce mot clé se réfère aux précises spécificités, auxquelles les produits ou les ressources naturelles doivent être conformes. Les normes peuvent être "obligatoires" ou "recommandées", "générales" (qui s'appliquent à une catégorie de produits) ou "spécifiques" (qui s'appliquent à un seul produit).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Las normas son disposiciones que establecen requisitos de conformidad para recursos naturales y productos. Las normas pueden ser "obligatorias" o "de recomendación", "generales" o "específicas".

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Release of fish, sea ranching, fish stocking, in relation also to sport fishing (trout), repopulation of wild animals.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Lâcher de poissons, élevage en mer, empoissonnement, aussi en relation avec la pêche sportive (truite), repeuplement d'animaux sauvage.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Liberación de peces, granjas piscícolas en el mar, siembra de peces, en relación también con la pesca deportiva (trucha), repoblación de animales silvestres.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Agreement between two or more of the constituent states of a federal State, e.g. between the federation and the states, or any agreement between public authorities within a sovereign state.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Accord entre deux ou plusieurs Etats faisant partie d'un Etat fédéral, ou bien entre la fédération et les Etats, ou tout accord entre des autorités publiques à l'intérieur d'un Etat souverain.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Acuerdo entre dos o más de los estados miembros de un estado federal, por ejemplo, entre federaciones y los estados, u cualquier acuerdo entre autoridades públicas de un estado soberano.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Subsidies-Payment or benefit given to partially offset the cost of specific activities, such as the manufacture, production, or export of an article. Incentives - Generally refers to financial incentives (compensation, interest subsidies, production subsidies, tax exemption, tax reduction, grants, bonuses, rewards, loans with low interest rates, etc.) set by a government in order to support the management and development of a given sector.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Cet mot-clé se réfère normalement aux incitations financières (compensation, subsides pour les intérêts, subsides à la production, détaxation, réduction des taxes, bourses, bonus, récompenses, prêts à bas taux d'intérêt, etc.) établies par un gouvernement afin de aider ou de relancer les activités commerciales dans un secteur donné.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a cualquier tipo de estímulo financiero (subsidio, exención de impuestos, reducción de impuestos, préstamos a interés bajo, etc.) establecido por un gobierno con el fin de sostener o fomentar actividades económicas/comerciales.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any carbohydrate sweetening matter.

Sugar cane is a perennial grass (replanted at certain intervals using pieces of the cane stalk) cultivated mainly between the tropics all over the world. In certain countries, sugar cane is also eaten raw in non-negligible quantities and used for feed. Sugar beet - A biennial plant grown as an annual crop, propagated by flower seeds, chiefly for the manufacture of sugar from its roots.

All water naturally open to the atmosphere, including rivers, lakes, reservoirs, ponds, streams, impoundments, seas, estuaries and wetlands. The term also covers springs, wells or other collectors of water that are directly influenced by surface waters.

The measuring of parcels/plots of land and the determining of its boundaries. Including survey practices; training, registration, licensing and qualification of surveyors; survey standards. Used also when Survey Boards are created. Hydrographic surveys support a variety of activities: nautical charting, port and harbor maintenance (dredging), coastal engineering (beach erosion and replenishment studies), coastal zone management, and offshore resource development. Surveys are concerned with water depth and the nature of the sea floor material.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Le mesurage de parcelles/lots de terre et leur délimitation. Sont inclus: les pratiques de relevé, la formation, l'enregistrement, la licence et la qualification des géomètres, les normes de mesuration. Egalement utilisés quand des bureaux de mesurage et de relevé sont créés. Les relevés hydrographiques servent pour: la cartographie marine, les ports et leur entretien (dragage), l’ingénierie côtière (érosion des plages et des études de reconstitution), la gestion des zones côtières, et le développement des ressources extracôtières. Les relevés concernent la profondeur de l'eau et la nature du fond marin.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La medición de parcelas/lotes de tierra y su delimitación. Incluye el levantamiento de planos topográficos, la preparación y recualificación de topógrafos, el registro, las licencias, las normas para la cartografía. Se utiliza también en relación a la creación de Oficinas del catastro. Los levantamientos hidrográficos incluyen una variedad de actividades, como: cartografía náutica, puertos y mantenimiento de puertos (dragado), ingeniería costera (erosión de playas y estudios de reposición), gestión de zonas costeras y desarrollo de recursos marinos. Los levantamientos se refieren a la profundidad del agua y la naturaleza del material del fondo marino.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Sustainable development is the organizing principle for meeting human development goals while simultaneously sustaining the ability of natural systems to provide the natural resources and ecosystem services on which the economy and society depend. The desired result is a state of society where living conditions and resources are used to continue to meet human needs without undermining the integrity and stability of the natural system. Sustainable development can be defined as development that meets the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FO; LA; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Use of resources in a way and at a rate that does not lead to the long-term degradation of the environment, thereby maintaining its potential to meet the needs and aspirations of present and future generations.
Any of various stout-bodied short-legged omnivorous artiodactyl mammals (family Suidae) with a thick bristly skin and a long flexible snout.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A tax is a financial charge on individuals or businesses collected by the Government.

Territorial sea, as defined by the 1982 United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, is a belt of coastal waters extending at most 12 nautical miles (22 km; 14 mi) from the baseline (usually the mean low-water mark) of a coastal state. The territorial sea is regarded as the sovereign territory of the state, although foreign ships (military and civilian) are allowed innocent passage through it, or transit passage for straits; this sovereignty also extends to the airspace over and seabed below.

a type of mineral water that is located deep underground which contains healing properties and is exempt from bacteria and pollution. Naturally pure and rich in mineral salts, iodine and CO2, thermal water is recognized for its therapeutic properties, particularly those that concern the skin.

Any wood or tree which has felled or has been felled or cut off and all wood whether unsawn, hewn, sawn or machined, split, or otherwise cut up or fashioned but does not include any article manufactured from such wood or firewood.
Generally refers to the process of felling and extracting timber from forests.
Any product prepared from the cured leaves of the tobacco plant.
The total allowable catch is the amount of marine living resources that can be harvested without endangering the aforementioned resources.
Tourism can be defined as the act of travel for the purpose of recreation, and the provision of services for this act.

Toxicity means a physiological or biological property which determines the capacity of a chemical to do harm or produce injury to a living organism by other than mechanical means. Poisoning means occurrence of damage or disturbance caused by a poison, and includes intoxication.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Propriétés physiologiques ou biologiques qui font qu'un produit chimique peut endommager ou altérer un organisme vivant par des moyens autres que mécaniques.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Propiedad fisiológica o biológica que determina la capacidad de una sustancia química para causar perjuicio o producir daños a un organismo vivo por medios no mecánicos
dictionary_term.Russian_Scope_Note: Способность вещества при одних определенных дозах вызывать нарушение жизнедеятельности организма, при других — отравление и гибель этого организма.
