dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; FI; FD; FO; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Ability to trace the application, location, and/or history of an activity or item by means of recorded data.
The Export, re-export, import and introduction from the sea of a species, i.e. an animal or plant, whether alive or dead, any recognizable part or derivate thereof.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Traditional knowledge (TK), indigenous knowledge (IK), traditional ecological knowledge (TEK) and local knowledge generally refer to knowledge systems embedded in the cultural traditions of regional, indigenous, or local communities.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Traditional or customary rights' refer to established, traditional patterns of norms that can be observed within a particular socio-cultural setting.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EN; LA; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental effects in adjacent State territories caused by various sources, i.e. underwater noise, marine discharges, atmospheric emissions, accidental events.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Effets sur le milieu dans les territoires des Etats adjacents causés par divers type de sources, telles que le bruit sous-marin, les rejets en eau marine, les émissions dans l'atmosphère, les événements accidentels.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Efectos ambientales en los territorios de Estados adyacentes causados por diversas fuentes, por ejemplo, ruido submarino, vertidos marinos, emisiones atmosféricas, accidentes.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any movement of hazardous wastes or other wastes from an area under the national jurisdiction of one State to or through an area under the national jurisdiction of another State or to or through an area not under the national jurisdiction of any State, provided at least two States are involved in the movement.
Transfer rights refer to the owner's right to give up to new owners the right to carry out any material and legal act of alteration, destruction, alienation or abandonment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Transportation provides the physical means of carrying goods from one place to another. Storage is the process concerned with retaining and preserving the goods.

Transshipment means the unloading of goods from one ship and its loading into another to complete a journey to a further destination, even when the cargo may have to remain ashore some time before its onward journey.

Food treatment refers to such preservation methods as: ionizing radiation, chemical and other preservation methods, irradiation, dehydration, freezing/quick freezing, refrigeration, heat processing, pasteurization, sterilization, thawing.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Par traitement des produits alimentaires on entend les méthodes de conservation telles que: les rayonnements ionisants, les méthodes de conservation chimiques ou autres, l'irradiation, la déshydratation , la congélation /surgélation , la réfrigération, la conservation par la chaleur , la pasteurisation, la stérilisation, l'appertisation , la décongélation.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: El tratamiento de alimentos se refiere a los métodos de conservación, tales como: radiaciones ionizantes, métodos de conservación químicos o de otro tipo, irradiación, deshidratación, congelamiento normal o rápido, refrigeración, tratamiento mediante calor, pasteurización, esterilización, descongelamiento.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any reptile with a body encased in a bony shell, including tortoises.

An uncodified constitution is the fundamental law of a sovereign state whose text is not embodied in a single document and is based upon customs, usage, judicial precedent and a variety of statutes and legal instruments.

A unitary state is a system of political organization in which the power resides in a centralized government, in contrast to a federal state. The central government is ultimately supreme and may create (or abolish) administrative divisions (sub-national units). Such units exercise only the powers that the central government chooses to delegate.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Un État unitaire est un système d'organisation politique dans lequel le pouvoir réside dans un gouvernement centralisé, par opposition à l'État fédéral. Le gouvernement central est le niveau le plus élevé et peut créer (ou supprimer) des divisions administratives (unités infranationales). Ces unités n'exercent que les pouvoirs que le gouvernement central décide de déléguer.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Un estado unitario es un sistema de organización política en el que el poder reside en un gobierno centralizado, de manera opuesta al estado federal. El gobierno central es el nivel supremo y puede crear (o abolir) divisiones administrativas (unidades subnacionales). Estas unidades ejercen únicamente los poderes que el gobierno central decide delegar.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: "Urban" agriculture refers to small areas (e.g. vacant plots, gardens, verges, balconies, containers) within the city for growing crops and raising small livestock or milk cows for own-consumption or sale in neighborhood markets. "Peri-urban" agriculture refers to farm units close to town which operate intensive semi- or fully commercial farms to grow vegetables and other horticulture, raise chickens and other livestock, and produce milk and eggs.

Urban areas are generally characterized by moderate and higher density residential, commercial, and industrial development, and the availability of public services required for that development, specifically central water and sewer, an extensive road network, public transit, and other such services (for example, safety and emergency response).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Includes conditions on use, e.g. soil conservation orders, use regulations, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Comprend les conditions pour l'utilisation, telles que les mesures de conservation du sol, les réglementations de l'utilisation, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye las condiciones para el uso, por ejemplo, medidas para la conservación del suelo, reglamentos para la utilización, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The immunisation of susceptible animals through the administration of a vaccine comprising antigens appropriate to the disease to be controlled.

A vegetable is the edible portion of a plant. Vegetables are usually grouped according to the portion of the plant that is eaten such as leaves (lettuce), stem (celery), roots (carrot), tubers (potato), bulbs (onion) and flowers (broccoli). Legume - the fruit or seed of plants of the legume family (such as peas or beans) used for food.
The sale of food products, including the informal retail sector.

Rights belonging to a person as a property interest which cannot be impaired or taken away (as through retroactive legislation) without the consent of the owner. Including acquired rights, established rights, customary rights, community rights.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Inclus les droits acquis, les droits pré-existants, les droits coutumiers, les droits des communautés.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye derechos adquiridos, derechos establecidos, derechos consuetudinarios, derechos comunitarios.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; EN; FI; FD; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Relates to veterinary medicines/medications, veterinary products, drugs used exclusively for animals.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce terme se réfère aux médicaments vétérinaires, aux produits vétérinaires, aux médicaments utilisés exclusivement pour les animaux.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a los productos veterinarios y medicinas de exclusivo uso animal.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Viticulture refers to the process of growing grapes, whereas viniculture and oenological practices refer to wine production.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Viticulture se réfère à la culture des raisins, alors que production et pratiques vinicoles se réfèrent à la production du vin.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Viticultura se refiere al cultivo de uva, ya que prácticas enológicas se refiere a la producción de vino.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; LA; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The collection , sorting, and transport of waste as well as its tipping above or under ground. Includes also waste dumping, i.e. the disposal of waste without environmental controls.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La collecte, le tri et le transport de déchets aussi bien que leur rejet sur ou sous terre. Inclut la mise en décharge de déchets, à savoir leur élimination sans prendre des mesures de protection de l'environnement.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La recolección, clasificación y transporte de desechos, así como su vertido sobre o debajo del terreno. Incluye también el vertimiento de desechos, por ejemplo, la eliminación de residuos sin controles ambientales.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; LA; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Household or Domestic Waste – Solid waste, composed of garbage and rubbish, which normally originates from residential, private households, or apartment buildings. Domestic waste may contain a significant amount of toxic or hazardous waste from improperly discarded pesticides, paints, batteries, and cleaners.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Déchets ménagers - résidus solides formés par les ordures provenant normalement des habitations privées ou des immeubles d'appartements. Les déchets ménager peuvent contenir une importante quantité de déchets toxiques ou dangereux provenant du rejet abusif de pesticides, vernis, batteries et détergents.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Residuos domésticos sólidos compuestos de desperdicios y basura que en general se producen de habitaciones privadas y residenciales o condominiales. Los desechos urbanos pueden contener cantidades significativas de residuos tóxicos o peligrosos provenientes de plaguicidas, pinturas, baterías y productos de limpieza incorrectamente eliminados.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FD; LA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Waste management is a set of activities that include the following: 1)collection, transport, treatment and disposal of waste; 2) control, monitoring and regulation of the production, collection, transport, treatment and disposal of waste; and 3) prevention of waste production through in-process modification, reuse and recycling. The term usually relates to all kinds of waste, whether generated during the extraction of raw materials, the processing of raw materials into intermediate and final products, the consumption of final products, or other human activities,] including municipal (residential, institutional, commercial), agricultural, and special (health care, household hazardous wastes, sewage sludge). Waste management is intended to reduce adverse effects of waste on health, the environment or aesthetics.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; LA; SE; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any solid, semi-solid or wastewater discarded from industrial, commercial, mining, or agricultural operations, and from community activities. Includes the runoff from areas that received pollutants associated with industrial or commercial storage, handling, or processing.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Tout déchet solide, semi-solide ou liquide provenant d'activités industrielles, commerciales, minières ou agricoles ainsi que d'activités communautaires. Inclut les écoulements provenant de zones ayant reçu des substances polluantes liées à des activités industrielles ou commerciales de production ou d'entreposage.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Todo tipo de desecho sólido, semisólido o agua residual proveniente de actividades industriales, comerciales, mineras o agrícolas, así como residuos urbanos. Incluye la escorrentía proveniente de áreas contaminadas por actividades relacionadas con el almacenamiento, manipulación o procesamiento industriales o comerciales.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Measures or techniques that reduce the amount and/or toxicity of wastes generated during industrial production processes.The term is also applied to recycling and other efforts to reduce the amount of waste going into the waste stream.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Mesures et techniques visant à réduire la quantité et/ou la toxicité des déchets provenant des processus de production industrielle; ce terme peut être aussi employé pour le recyclage et les autres systèmes visant à réduire la quantité de déchets entrant en circulation.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Medidas o técnicas que reducen la cantidad y/o toxicidad de residuos producidos durante los procesos industriales de producción; el término también se aplica al reciclaje y a otros intentos para reducir la cantidad de desechos que van a parar en el flujo de residuos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Water abstraction is the process of taking water from any source, either temporarily or permanently, for flood control or to obtain water for, for example, irrigation.

Water charges refers to the payments that a beneficiary makes for a water service (domestic supply, irrigation, etc.). The action of establishing the price, or tariff, on the basis of which water charges are calculated is often referred to as water pricing but is clearly very different from the formal economic ‘pricing’ of water as a natural resource, where the notion of shadow pricing applies.

Designated area put in place to safeguard the safe and secure use and sufficient quantities of surface water and groundwater for drinking water production or the conservation of habitat or species directly depending on the water zone.
Process of removing dissolved salt and other minerals from seawater to create freshwater.
Measures that define the desired condition of purity or quality for any waters in relation to their reasonable and necessary use.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: gestion des resources en eau douce
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Water resources management (WRM)- the process of planning, developing, and managing water resources, in terms of both water quantity and quality, across all water uses.

The right to abstract, use and transfer water. It also includes the ownership of water. Usually in the form of a permit, but water rights can have different sources such as custom (established use) or ownership of (riparian) land.
Lack of safe water due to arid conditions or distribution problems. Provisions on emergency situations.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Dispositions relatives aux situations d'urgence.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Disposiciones relativas a situaciones de emergencia.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Supply of water for domestic, commercial, thermoelectric power, industrial, public water uses (fountains, fire hydrants, field delivery point, etc.).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: L'approvisionnement en eau pour usage domestique, commercial, de génération de pouvoir thermoélectrique, industriel et public (fontaines publiques, bornes d' incendie, points de livraison sur-le-champ, etc.)
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Abastecimiento de agua potable, para uso comercial, termoeléctrico, industrial, uso de aguas públicas (fuente, bocas de agua para incendios, bocas de riego, etc.).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Cooperation associations of Water users who undertake water related activities for their mutual benefit.
A manmade structure that serves the purpose of diverting, restricting, stopping, or otherwise controlling the natural flow of water.
A wild plant growing where it is not wanted and in competition with cultivated plants.
A well is an excavation or structure created in the ground by digging, driving, or drilling to access liquid resources, usually water.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FI; FO; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Areas of marsh, fen, peatland or water, whether natural or artificial, permanent or temporary, with water that is static or flowing, fresh, brackish or salt, including areas of marine water the depth of which at low tide does not exceed six meters.
Undomesticated animals living independently of humans.
Plants growing in a natural state (independent of humans, therefore not cultivated).
Products derived from any readily recognizable part or derivative of a wild species, such as elephant ivory, tiger products, corals, bushmeat.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to any area/zone specifically designated and delineated by law for control purposes.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à toute superficie/zone spécifiquement désignée et délimitée par la loi pour des raisons de contrôle.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a toda zona o área específicamente establecida y delimitada por ley con fines de control.
